loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a married woman and a mother of of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has engaged in a fishing business for more than three years now with her husband. This is their main source of income. Thelma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch and sell more fish in the market. Thelma hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 45 years old. He is from Nyandarua South and is married. They have four children aged between 21 and 15 years old.

Charles is a farmer and has been in it for many years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a cow. Charles hopes to get a lot of milk supplies from the dairy cow that he intends to buy. 

He hopes to expand his farming business in the near future and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a 21,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
 
Florence has operated a milk selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as a major challenge to her business.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase gallons of milk for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia appreciated her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business as well as earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more bales of clothes for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married and has two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: George

texts.en:
This is George, who is 22 years old and lives in Kutaisi city. He lives with his parents. George works as a builder locally on special projects, but his earnings are unstable from that activity and are not enough to cover utilities and food costs. For this reason, George has decided to diversify the business and start up a small café, where various pies and fast food products will be sold.  

According to George’s estimation, sales will be high, as the location where he plans to start his cafe is crowded with people. He has already hired the commercial space and needs money to purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials. The income from the café will be a great support for the family as it will generate additional income. George appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a food cafe

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 23 years old and married, living in a capital city suburb with her husband and in-laws. Nino doesn’t have any business or source of income. Her family members are employed at different private companies and get monthly salaries.  

In order to generate income on her own, Nino decided to start the business and purchase cellphones and accessories for selling from a small store. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial condition and lack of experience. A loan of $2,500 will help Nino to purchase cellphones in bulk and sell them for a profit. 

Nino is very enthusiastic and a hardworking person with a great desire to get ahead. This credit will be a great support for the family. Nino is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase cellphones and accessories in bulk for resale

loans.name: Lorita

texts.en:
Lorita, age 37, is from a suburb of the capital city. She is married to Avtandil, and they have two school-age children. Lorita's economic activity is her newly started grocery store near her house, where she sells different kinds of food products. Avtandil and Lorita work as salespersons in their store and serve their clients in a friendly way.  

The project is going well, but it needs financial support for further developing. Now, Lorita is requesting a loan to add stock of merchandise to her store. With the received amount, she will buy products such as rice, dairy products, snacks and other products. She will enlarge her store and attract more customers. Lorita plans to increase her turnover gradually and invest the profits in the same business. Lorita awaits your support.

loans.use: to add stock of merchandise to her grocery store

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Originally from Kampot province, about 148 kilometers distance from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, Srey is a married mother of four schoolchildren. She strives for a living via rice farming as the primary source of income and raises crickets for resale as a supplementary source of income. Additionally, her husband also helps her to earn extra income via driving a motor-taxi for a fee. This is the business that she has had for 23 years. 

Srey is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking an education loan in order to cover the tuition fee of her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in international relations. She highly hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee of her daughter

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Chhoy, aged 54, is married and has four children. He has been working in agriculture to earn a living. Chhoy primarily grows rice on almost two hectares of farmland in Pursat province. With help from his wife, Chhoy is able to make approximately 8.33 USD per day, which he uses for his daily meals, home bills and other costs.

With the purpose of aiming to improve the family’s living conditions, Chhoy is asking for a loan to build a bathroom for the household. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Chhoy to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a bathroom for the household.

loans.name: Hennah Mae

texts.en: Due to lack of job opportunities, Hennah Mae engages in selling AVON and Board Walk products within her local community. She knows that through this kind of business she can help her parents in generating income. Hennah Mae aims to make her business profitable in order to earn a higher income. To reach her goals, she requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more stocks of AVON and Board Walk products to sell. She believes that this loan will help her make her business productive and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of AVON and Board Walk products to sell

loans.name: Nicoline

texts.en:
Nicoline is single and a mother of three children. They live in a one-bedroom house in Bamenda. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness, inadequate capital to finance a business of her own, and worst of all, the death of her sister.


With this new loan requested, she will buy Koki beans, oil, fowls and feed. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long time, has regular customers who buy from her, and there's high demand for fowls. With this business activity, the community will benefit from moderate prices, she will also provide food for people at their job sites, and the waste from the fowls will also be used as manure to boast high yields. 

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family needs, ensure her children's education, increase her capital and also complete her house. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed, and also, social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy Koki beans, oil, fowls and feed.

loans.name: Anny Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Estrella  Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Anny, tiene 45  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Anny es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para ganar sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarles a sus hijos para los gastos de sus estudios, ella los fines de semana y feriados instala un pequeño restaurante en su casa, allí con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden su negocio el cual es muy concurrido en estos días ya que es cuando muchos turistas visitan estas playas ya que son las mejores de Manta, la especialidad de la casa son los mariscos de preferencia el pescado apanado acompañado de patacones, arroz y ensalada, esto es lo que más le piden sus clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Estrella Del Mar" (Star of the Sea) meets every 15 days on the beautiful beach of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Most of the residents in this place are devoted to fishing and other jobs related to the sea.

Sra. Anny lives in this place. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children (ages 17 and 15) who are in high school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña Anny is woman who likes to feel worthy by earning her own income. With what she earns, she is able to help her children with their educational expenses. On weekends and public holidays, she operates a small restaurant from her home. Her children help with tending to the business since it is very busy on those days when there are many tourists visiting the best beaches in Manta. The specialty of the house is seafood, preferably breaded fish served with fried plantains, rice, and a salad. This dish is what is most requested by her customers.

This loan will be used to buy fish, shrimp, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. Anny has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have allowed her to move forward. Her dreams include having a large restaurant and providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Eugenio Leopoldo

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 58 años de edad es casado vive con sus familiares en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Eugenio  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar mucho más. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar bingo para sacar fondos para algun programa.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 58 years old, married, and lives with his family members in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank "Bruniquilde", which is located in the neighborhood of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. Eugenio is devoted to farm work.

He is a farmer who grows corn. Eugenio is requesting a loan in order to buy necessary supplies for farming such as compost, insecticides, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas.

Eugenio's dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenge he faces is having to do more work. In his free time, he enjoys playing bingo in order to raise funds for some type of program.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Forestal  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Florestal. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como  agricultura, cría de animales, comercio, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Mercedes, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos de 18, 12 y 9  años de edad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Mercedes es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de varios artículos de catalogo como ropa, zapatos, joyas y productos de Yanbal, Avon y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad la misma que empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal pero ya estaba en otro grupo desde hace más de 6 años. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo within the Calderón province, the members of the Florestal communal bank meet every 2 weeks.  This place is known for its delicious cuisine and it's greenery.  The majority of its citizens work in farming or business.

This is a group of people that decided to come together and form this communal bank.  It will help them a lot, since with these loans they will be able to improve their small businesses.  They work in a variety of areas, including farming, raising animals, retail, selling food, and other things.

Mercedes is one of the members of this group.  She is married (in a free union) and has three children with her husband (ages 18, 12, and 9).  Her younger children are studying in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Mercedes is a housewife who works so as to have her own income and also help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells a variety of items via catalog, including clothes, shoes, jewelry, and Yanbal, Avon, and Belcorp products (which include beauty products, makeup, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day between 2 and 3 hours.  She makes her sales on credit and collects payments every week.  She has been doing this job for 6 years and got started thanks to a loan that she obtained through a bank.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, makeup, and underwear.  This is her first loan with this communal bank and was previously involved in another bank for more than 6 years.  Her goals include giving her children the very best.

loans.use: buy perfume, creams, makeup, and underwear.

loans.name: Welyneth

texts.en:
Welyneth is a merchant from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 5 years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood.

Welyneth is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients, etc. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Welyneth hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
This is Nyamvula. She previously accessed a loan that she used to purchase clothes for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial support with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She operates an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married mother of five children, four of whom attend school while one is still young. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children, bills, and food for her family.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling to neighbors and passersby in her locality. The major challenges she faces are seasonality and competition in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat is an industrious woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. She is the main breadwinner for her children as her husband doesn’t send enough money for living. Bashorat has her own business deal selling food products in her shop. Bashorat has been busy with this business for some years. She always tries to update items. She is going to buy food items for the New Year season, but she does not have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy food items such as meat and preserves. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items such as meat and preserves for increasing working capital

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, a 34-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, four sons, and two daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is a cook. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Amina is trying to help him fulfill their needs by sewing clothes. She is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Amina requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. With the help of the loan she hopes to reach her desired net income and be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
SINIGNESSIGUI est un groupe de l’association NIETAGA de Kangaré. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de d’habillements, de cosmétiques et de céréale à l’image de OUMOU  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Kangaré dans la  préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
OUMOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  deux Balles de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  Kangaré en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sinignessigui Group is part of Nietaga Association in Kangaré. It is made up of six women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

They are married and average 40 years of age and four children, and live in large traditional families in Kangaré, Sélingué Prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

They've been in the retail business for several years and are very much in demand. Eager to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling clothing, cosmetics, and cereals. This is the case with Oumou, who is the first woman on the left in the standing row in the photograph.

She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, and retails her products in Kangaré, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 62), which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Siguidayiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
SIGUIDAYIRIWASO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de KANGARE. Il regroupe 10 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne six enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de d’habillements, de céréales, de cosmétiques et parures à l’image de ANTA  qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il ya trois ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
ANTA, excelle dans la vente d’habillements et de parures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  10 pièces de pagnes wax et des parures.  Elle s’approvisionne Bamako  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  KANGARE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Siguidayiriwaso Group is part of Benkadi Association in Kangaré. It is made up of ten women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

They are married and average 38 years of age and six children, and live in large traditional families in Kangaré, Yanfolila Prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

They've been in the retail business for several years and are very much in demand. Eager to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, three years ago. They are seeking their sixth solidarity loan (group loan).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling clothing, cereals, cosmetics, and fineries. This is the case with Anta, who is the second woman from the left in the standing row in the photograph.

She excels in selling clothing and fineries. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 pieces of Wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and fineries. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, and retails her products in Kangaré, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 62), which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of Wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and fineries

loans.name: Sol Naciente - 32 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Sol Naciente - 32 Group, está compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un  varón,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Flora tiene 69 años, cliente antigua de la institucion,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Flora,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor y así surtir su negocio, ya que la razón para solicitar este y ,los anteriores préstamos es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Flora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por ella y por sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso sacan solas adelante a su familias.
texts.en: The Sol Naciente -32 communal bank is made up of 9 members (8 women and one man).  They all work in different fields.  Flora is the president of the bank and is 69 years old and has been involved in the bank for a long time.  She works selling seasonal clothing and sells her goods in various markets in the city of Cochabamba.  This is her first loan in this bank.  She will use it to buy clothing wholesale and in this way stock up her business, since her reason for asking for this loan and her previous loans is to increase her merchandise.  Flora faces challenges in her business such as competition and she will use this loan to continue to buy merchandise and in this way generate more income.  She is happy and thankful because she and her group members in many cases are the only income-earning members of their families.

loans.use: buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, se dispone a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tres llantas para su unidad de transporte, con lo que dará mayor seguridad y mantendrá la preferencia a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le dio la oportunidad de mejorar la unidad de transporte, sus clientes aumentaron, sus ingresos extras le han permitido cancelar la deuda adquirida y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is prepared to provide better service to his customers. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of three tires for his vehicle. This will provide better safety and allow him to maintain the loyalty of his customers.

His previous loan gave him the opportunity to improve his vehicle and increase his clientele. The extra income allowed him to pay off the debt he acquired and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy three tires.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela se ha caracterizado por su empuje y el empeño que pone a cada actividad que realiza. A sus 47 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos de 11 y 3 años; trabaja como independiente vendiendo comidas en un puesto que adaptó en la esquina de un colegio cercano a su vivienda, el oficio lo comenzó hace dos años, vendiendo tamales en compañía de una vecina con quien compartía las ganancias, pero un tiempo después su compañera se fue y ella continuo sola con el negocio, al ver los buenos resultados que obtuvo, comenzó a vender chuzos y chorizos, trabaja todos los días de 11 am a 9 pm y así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Su mayor desafío es el clima que está en constante cambio, por lo que se ven afectadas sus ventas, especialmente cuando llueve; sin embargo esto no la detiene, ella sigue luchando incansablemente, motivada por su espíritu de superación. Solicita el crédito con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, con el dinero comprará un asador BBQ de 4 quemadores, una olla grande para tamales, un fogón industrial, una carpa e insumos al por mayor (carne, verduras, salsas, productos desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y podrá agilizar la cocción de sus alimentos, logrando atraer más clientes y fidelizando los que ya posee, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Ángela manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es posicionar mejor su negocio y en un futuro cercano tener la posibilidad de montarlo en un local comercial, que le genere mayor rentabilidad para tener la oportunidad de adquirir su casa propia y brindar mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela is known for her perseverance and the effort that she puts into everything that she does.  She is 47 years old, is married, and is a mother to two children (ages 11 and 3).  She works as an independent food vendor at a stall that she set up on a corner near the high school close to her house.  She started this business 2 years ago by selling tamales with the help of a neighbor with whom she split the profits.  After a while, however, her friend left and she continued the business on her own.

Once she saw how good business was going, she started selling kabobs and chorizo.  She works every day from 11 am to 9 pm and in this way has been able to make enough money to help her husband pay for the household expenses.  Her greatest obstacle is the weather, which is constantly changing and subsequently affects her sales when for instance it is raining.  This doesn't stop her, however, and she continues tirelessly  due to her desire to get ahead.

She is asking for a loan with the desire to strengthen her business.  With the money, she will buy a barbecue grill with 4 burners, a large tomale pot, an industrial stove, an awning, and wholesale supplies (including meat, vegetables, sauces, and disposable goods).  This will allow her to improve her working conditions, help speed up her food production, and allow her to attract more customers while remaining loyal to the ones she already has.  In this way, she will improve her sales and increase her income.

Ángela says that her greatest desire is to improve her business and in the near future have the chance to open a store.  This would increase it's usefulness and allow her eventually to buy her own house and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a barbecue grill with 4 burners, a large tomale pot, an industrial stove, an awning, and wholesale supplies (including meat, vegetables, sauces, and disposable goods).

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El señor Felipe, un comerciante del Municipio de Ticuantepe, el tiene un pequeño taller de Muebles, su esposa es tambien comerciante vende productos de bellazas y cosmeticos, le apoya incondicionalmente, don Felipe esta solicitando el crdioto para la compra de Tablones de Coyote, Ceiba, Pochote. para realizar muebles y luego venderlos otros son por encargos que los clientes ya le han solicitado. el esta muy agradecido con fondos Kiva y Afodenic por el apoyo y confianza que han depositado en el
texts.en:
Felipe's a merchant from the town of Ticuantepe.  He has a small furniture shop.  His wife is also a merchant; she sells beauty products and cosmetics.  She supports him unconditionally.

Felipe's requesting the loan to buy coyote, ceiba, and pochote wood boards to make furniture to sell.  Other pieces have been ordered by customers.

He's very grateful to Kiva Funds and AFODENIC for their support and trust.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Santa Otilia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene  40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 22 y 15 años, el menor estudia en colegio, ambos vive en su casa. Su esposo por temporadas  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Santa para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo y su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos están desocupados de sus actividades, pero la mayor parte del tiempo es ella que está en su local ya que le gusta estar allí atendiendo a su clientela, también en ocasiones sale a recorrer ya que también vende ropa de todo tipo en su local y puerta a puerta con lo cual se gana algo extra, lleva 10 años con su negocio el cual le da muchas satisfacciones.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "San José" meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this lovely place. Most of the residents are hard workers who are devoted to jobs related to the sea.

Sra. Santa lives in this place. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children (ages 22 and 15). The younger child is in high school. Both of her children live at home. Her husband works seasonally as a fisherman.

In order for her and her family to get ahead, Doña Santa manages a grocery store in her home. There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M., but sometimes much later. Her husband and her son help with the work when they are not busy with their activities. Most of her time is spent at her shop since she enjoys attending to her customers. On occasion, she will sell clothing of all types from her shop or by going door to door in order to earn some extra money. Santa has been in business for 10 years and it has given her great satisfaction.

This loan will be used to buy more inventory for her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other basic necessities. Santa has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because of the help the loans have provided. Her dreams include improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Miryan Mariela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Miryan, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 10 y 9 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es chofer.
Doña Miryan además de ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal, Avon y Belcorp  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, sale a recorrer por la localidad y también vende en su casa lugar en el cual tiene unas vitrinas, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual  le ayuda a su marido sobretodo con los gastos de estudios de sus pequeños.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Grupo De crédito  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Esperanza Nueva communal bank meets every 2 weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for it's beautiful greenery and for being very dynamic.  The majority of its citizens work in farming or raising animals.

Miryan lives in this place and is 38 years old.  She is married (in a free union) and has 3 children with her husband (ages 13, 10, and 9).  They are all enrolled in school.  Her husband works in transportation.  

Miryan, in addition to being a great mother and wife, also works selling Yanbal, Avon, and Belcorp products (including beauty products, makeup, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day and travels throughout her community in addition to selling from her house, where she has some display cases.  She sells on credit and collects payments every week.  She has been doing this for 10 years and by so doing is able to help her husband with the school expenses of their children.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, and makeup.  This is her second loan with this communal bank and she likes it because thanks to these loans she is able to progress.  Her dream is that her children always have everything they need to succeed in life.

loans.use: buy perfume, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: Erin

texts.en:
Erin is a married woman with two children. She is 29 years old and one of her children is still in school. 

Erin is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years, and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Erlinda is borrowing 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more dry goods such as scissors, hats, belts, and lamps for her dry goods business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods such as scissors, hats, belts, and lamps for resale

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Flaviana requested a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
María, es casada, tiene dos hijos, los cuales se mantienen estudiando, se dedica a tender su restaurante llamado La Guacamaya, que está ubicado en su localidad, ya tiene 2 años de haberlo fundado, lo atiende con ayuda de una sobrina, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y variedad otro tipo de comida rápida.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de carnes, verduras, bebidas y golosinas, para ofrecer  a los estudiantes de los alrededores, le ayudara incrementar sus ventas y los ingresos con los que mejorara las condiciones familiares y podrá cancelar responsablemente su crédito.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable para cancelar las deudas y dar a sus hijos una buna educación.
texts.en:
María is married, has two school-age children, and works running a restaurant called la Guacamaya.  It is located in her community and she started it 2 years ago.  She runs it with the help of her niece.  Her schedule is from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm and she offers breakfast, lunch, and a variety of fast food.

She will invest her loan in buying meat, vegetables, drinks, and sweets to sell to the students in the area.  This will help her increase her sales and allow her to improve the quality of life of her family.  She will be able to pay off her loan.  Hers goals include being able to improve her business so she can pay off her loans and give her children a good education.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, drinks, and sweets.

loans.name: Roeurm's Group

texts.en:
Roeurm is 51 years old and a mother of eight children. She resides in Moung Russey district of Battambang province where rice cropping is the popular business among her neighbors as well as for her family.  Besides one hectare of rice farming, she earns additional income working for others for a fee during her spare time. Both businesses typically provide her a return about 28,500 KHR per day. 

This is the third microloan for Roeurm with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled to improve her livelihood at a gradual pace. Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She highly hopes that she will receive a high crop yield so that she can get a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice farming

loans.name: Saroeum's Group

texts.en:
Saroeum, age 30 and a resident of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, is also a mother of two little kids. She struggles to meet a daily cost of living via rice farming as her main source of income. She works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has engaged in this business for just two years, which enables her to earn almost 25,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day. 

Saroeum, a second-time borrower, forms a group of two with a first-time borrower in order to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) again. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her livelihood at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is seeking 200,000 KHR. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can make a good yield, better than last year, and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sokneat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Sokneat is a young married mother blessed with one little kid. To ensure decent daily food for her family, she and her husband grow cassava as their primary source of income and raise pigs for supplementary income. 

This is the first loan for Sokneat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is forming a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more piglets for raising plus feed. Additionally, she will spend a portion of her loan to pay for reaping her cassava yield. She hopes that she can raise her pigs healthfully so that she can get a good selling price.

loans.use: To pay for reaping her cassava yield

loans.name: Ricardo Adolfo

texts.es: Don ricardo de 48 años de edad se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas desde hace varios años, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposa ella se dedica  ala crianza de pollos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposa logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don ricardo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para bicicletas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Ricardo is 48 years old. He has been repairing bicycles for several years. His workshop is located in his house. He lives in his own house with his wife. She raises chickens. With what he obtains from his work and with the help from his wife, they are able to meet some of the expenses of their household. Ricardo is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts for bicycles because this is his only source of work and it will allow him to have better earnings and to have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Victor ha trabajado la tierra desde muy joven gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le han dejado como herencia el amor a la agricultura misma que hoy en dia ha hecho que el pueda prosperar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, casado, padre de hijos ya mayores que le ayudan con el trabajo. el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos agricolas como. completo, urea, triple, etc. asi su cosecha de Piyahaya esta optima para que pueda floreser y dar buenos frutos, ademas evitar la propagacion de plagas en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Víctor has worked the land from a very young age, thanks to the support of his parents, who gave him a love of farming as a legacy.  This has allowed him to prosper and improve his living conditions today.  He's married and the father of adult children who help him with the work.

Víctor's requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as urea and Completo and Triple fertilizers.  This way his dragon fruit harvest will be ideal for flourishing and giving good products.  He'll also avoid the propagation of pests on his plants.

loans.use: to take care of his crop

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi, 30 years of age, is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost one year and earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her profits are usually spent on school fees and daily expenditures. Due to lack of capital for her retail store, she would like to request a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase beverages, dried fish, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, dried fish, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 50-year-old widow with one child and she works very hard to provide for her child.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, snack foods, noodles, sugar, toothpaste, etc. 

Genara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general stor.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is aged 32 years, married, and has one child. Being a responsible father, he aims to become financially stable in order to satisfy the necessities of his family. To generate additional income, he operates his motorcycle transport within his community. 

To continuously maintain his motorcycle in good condition, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy wheels, spare parts, and accessories needed for his motorcycle. He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy wheels, spare parts, and accessories needed for his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: A local citizen from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Savy is 31 years old and a single lady who strives to make a living via rice farming and planting mango. It is the business that she has had for more than 10 years. Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Savy is seeking her first microloan to buy potash, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop and use a small portion to buy more grocery items for resale as additional income. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her existing and new business.

loans.use: to buy potash, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop and to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Elisabeth Newu

texts.en:
Elisabeth Newu is married and a mother of four children. They live in a two-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life (sickness, the death of her mother and two brothers, thieves breaking into her house, and financial difficulties starting up a business, to mention a few). 

With this new loan requested, she will invest in buying groundnuts, vegetables, fertilizer, and seedlings such as corn and beans. She will also farm cassava and Irish potatoes. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and has regular customers who buy from her and also because the demand for foodstuffs is always high. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, providing food for a rapid increasing population.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, provide food for the family and save in order to meet emergency needs. She prefers loans from GHAPE (Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment) because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Also, members' social needs are catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, vegetables, and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 58-year-old married  man.  Salim   is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables from his place in a central bazaar and from his home. He has 13 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers because he was a merchant in a food market.

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and they also make fresh punch. His monthly income is 120 AZN. 

Now  Salim wants to repair his market but he has not enough funds. For that, he wants to take a loan of 1,000 AZN .This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to repair his market

loans.name: Fassoun

texts.fr:
Monsieur  FASSOUN  est âgé de 47 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son épouse dans le village de FARABA sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de Koulikoro.
FASSOUN n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales, et des articles divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant d’articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt  qui servira à acheter des articles divers : produits alimentaires, de beauté et des jouets  auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à FARABA et village environnant  à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
FASSOUN espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fassoun is 47 years old, and lives with his wife and five children in the village of Faraba.  Faraba is in the sub-prefecture of Kourouba, in the Koulikoro region.

Fassoun didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  He started working at a young age in the purchase and sale of cereals and various other items.  He learnt his trade from his maternal uncle, who used to be a big trader of various items.

In order to satisfy the needs of his customers, Fassoun began working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be his fourth loan with this field partner.  He will use his loan to buy various items (food products, beauty products and toys) from wholesalers in Bamako.  Fassoun will then resell these products in the area around Faraba.  He sells to many customers, on a cash or credit basis.

Fassoun hopes to earn a monthly average of 120,000 francs CFA, he will use his earnings to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 42 years old and lives in the village of Mukhiani. He is single and lives with his retired parents. Paata grows greens on his own piece of land and sells the harvest at the local open market periodically. In addition, he breeds two milk cows and takes good care of his livestock. His income from agriculture is seasonal and modest, so the family lives in poverty. 

Paata decided to apply for this loan and start his greenhouse business. He is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering him, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase all the needed materials for his greenhouse construction. He plans to grow various greens in wintertime and plant tomatoes and cucumbers in summer. He will sell his harvest the whole year and generate income. Thanks to this loan, he will improve their quality of life and increase the family funds. Paata awaits your support.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: A 49-year-old mother of five children originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Chantha is a local farmer who grow edible arum as her main source of income. Besides this agribusiness, she also tailors clothes in her local area to earn additional income. The business that she has had for 20 years earns her about 39,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, Chantha is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans completely and the loans have improved her living conditions as well as kept her kids in school. Now, she leads a huge group of six borrowers to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and four other borrowers are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy good arum seedling for replanting and to buy potash to boost its yield. She hopes that she can make more income from this business so that she can renovate her house and keep her kids in school until tertiary (university) level.

loans.use: To buy good arum seedlings and potash

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children.

She operates a vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing her business in the future. 

With the KES loan 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, 30, is a mother of one little child living in Siem Reap province. For her family, rice farming on four hectares of farmland is the single source of income which has generated her about 18,000 KHR in order to support the daily cost of living. 

Neang, who has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for past three cycles and has fully repaid back the loans already, has formed a group of two to get a new loan.  She is applying for 1,200,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is seeking for 200,000 KHR. As the leader, Neang will spend her entire loan portion to pay the fee for workers to harvest her crops. She hopes to collect her yield on time so that she can sell with a good price with a good profit in return.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fee to workers

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en: Enkhbat, 43 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a hairdresser at a barbershop since 2010. Her husband stopped rendering taxi service due to a car breakdown. Using her previous loan, she purchased an electric car for her son. Now she is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car for her husband. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. Her husband is a very hardworking individual and will use the car for taxi service because he can't sit idle without working.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1965, FATOUMATA vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux à MANA dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
FATOUMATA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce de céréales et d’articles divers. FATOUMATA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales et de produits alimentaires : arachide, niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les 4 prêts précédents, FATOUMATA est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, MANA et MORIDJAMBOUGOU) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
FATOUMATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fatoumata was born around 1965, and lives with her husband and their seven children, in a nuclear family.  They live in the rural area of Ouelessebougou.

Fatoumata began working at a young age, with her aunt who bought and sold cereals and other products.  After building up several years of experience with her aunt, Fatoumata decided to buy and sell cereals and other food products (peanuts, black-eyed peas, millet, fonio, maize, hibiscus flower, etc).

This will be her fifth loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  Her previous four loans were all correctly repaid on time.  Fatoumata will use her loan to buy fifty sacks of millet from farmer-producers (in Ouelessebougou, Mana or Moridjambougou) or, occasionally, from local wholesalers.  She sells her product on a cash or credit basis, from her home, at the market in Ouelessebougou or at local fairs.  Most of her sales are directly to consumers.

Fatoumata hopes to earn 50,000 francs CFA a month, and she will use her earnings to help her husband with the expenses of their family, to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice used her previous loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. It was profitable and she repaid the loan successfully. Besides farming, she also has a mobile money transfer business which she has been running for the past year and she makes a monthly income of KES 9,500. 

She plans to use the loan to add more money float to the mobile money transfer business. She will also buy more stock of mobile phone accessories such as chargers, batteries, cables, phone covers and earphones. She will use the generated profits to educate her children.

Her future hopes are to build rental houses as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To add money float and phone accessories.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 49 years old and he lives in Sevan city which is in Gegharkunik region. Arsen is married and he lives with his wife, his son and his daughter. Arsen’s son is on military services in the army and his daughter works at a food market as a salesgirl. Arsen has two higher educations and a specialty of pedagogic and is also an inspector of baby foods. 

Several years Arsen worked at a bread factory as a leading specialist and now he works at a private company as a technologist. Arsen is very good father and beloved husband in his family and provides for his family perfectly. For many years Arsen has a great desire to buy a car, but he has not enough money for such a purchase. 

He asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a car, which will make his great wish come true after so many years.

loans.use: to buy a car to make his great wish come true

loans.name: Saveung's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Saveung is 31 years old and a mother blessed with three children who are currently in school. To earn a living, she grows rice and cassava with support from her husband who also spends his time in catching fish for resale to supplement the family’s income. 

Now, Saveung and her joint borrower, who have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) at least four cycles, have fully repaid their past loan already. Now, she is a leader of this group. Savoeung will spend her entire portion to pay the plowing fee and labor costs and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She highly believes that she gain get more income from her business so as she can improve her living at a gradual pace.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and labor costs and to buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 33-year-old married man.  He is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods including macaroni, butter, and candies. He has 8 years of experience and has extensive knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients.

Murad sells food products that are very popular and are in high demand. His monthly profit selling foods is 200 AZN. His brother helps him to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for his family. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good business location which is in the central bazaar of his home city.

He applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover his customers` demands.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Sanani

texts.en:
Sanani is a 55 year-old married man with three children. He has bred livestock from a very young age thanks to his father who taught him well. He already has 10 years of experience. During these years, Sanani has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price in a livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.

His business requires a lot of physical strength, as Sanani spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. His monthly income is 150 AZN and Sanani wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put into his business and cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two cattle, one milkier cow and fodder. This will be his first loan

loans.use: to buy cattle, one milkier cow and fodder

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon is a 45-year-old woman and a citizen from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is one of the breadwinners in the family which consists of two children. Rice farming enables her to deal with the basic needs in her household.  Mon also has a paid-working job during her spare time. 

She earns about 21,000 KHR per day from these businesses. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Mon and her fellow group member are requesting 1,200,000 KHR each.  They are second-time borrowers and have fully repaid their past loan. As a leader, Mon will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and to pump water for her rice field. She hopes that she can make double income to expand her business generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop and to pump water for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is smart woman. She was born in 1963 in a working family. She was one of the best pupils in a school. After graduating from school, she entered the Pedagogical University. Since 1987, she has worked in a school. She teaches geography. Mavluda is a married parent of three children. Her children are adults. Her husband is a businessman. Mavluda and her husband made repairs to their house. Now, they want to buy furniture but they have no money. Mavluda is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widowed woman who has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children as she is the breadwinner in the family. 

She has been operating a fish selling business for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old enthusiastic man living with his retired mother and grandmother. David is an auto mechanic and is employed at the local auto repair shop in return for a monthly salary. His earnings are very small and unstable, so the family lives in poverty and gets small-sized social assistance from the local government. 

That's why he decided to start his own business. With this start-up credit, David will construct a building and purchase all the equipment needed to set up an auto repair shop there. He will work as a mechanic and serve the local drivers in return for a fee. David hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative as he has rich experience in that field and he will make his family members' lives easier.

loans.use: to start an auto repair shop

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang is a local farmer residing in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 34 years old and has three dependent children. During his free time, her husband also helps to earn more income via catching fish for resale. 

The farming business has generated Sreyneang about 18,800 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for her group, consisting of three female borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For Sreyneang, the positive impact of her past loan, which she has repaid, has been to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pump water for her crop and to buy a decent motorbike to shipping vegetable for resale. She hopes that she can earn more income via her crop so that she can expand her business in a larger scale.

loans.use: to pump water for her crop and buy a motorbike for transporting crops to market

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: İxtiyar

texts.en: İxtiyar is single and lives with his parents in Baku region. His father has been sick for 3 years and Ixtiyar's mother takes care of him. Ixtiyar's parents do not work (earn an income) and Ixtiyar provides for his family. He builds the foundations of houses. He requests a loan of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to buy construction materials including fixtures and wire. Ixtiyar is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for their help. In the future, he wants to get married and have children. He also wants to hire an assistant in the future to help with his work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is married and the father of three children. They live in the Baku region. His wife is a housewife and doesn’t work in business. One of his children is 13 years old and goes to the sixth grade class, another is 10 years old and goes to the fourth grade class,  and the smallest is 8 years old and goes to the second grade class of school. 

Zakir has been a taxi driver for three years. Zakir adores his family and to support them, he works hard. Today he needs a loan of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car’s interior. Therefore he has applied to the Komak company for a loan. Zakir is thankful to  the Komak company, Kiva organization, and lenders for help. In the future he wants to change the wheels of his car.

loans.use: to repair his car’s interior for use as a taxi

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old married father of three children.  He has been working in the sanitary and tiles business since May 2011.
Ali is a hard worker who has developed his business to make sure that he can respond to his family and customer needs.
Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his merchandise with current items and tools for the special sanitary and tiles business. 
Ali hopes to expand his business and start working in the wholesale trade and be capable of covering most construction projects in nearby villages.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with current items and tools for the special sanitary and tiles business.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda is 25 years old and a local villager from Kandal province.  She earns a living as a local school teacher. This occupation generates around 8.50 USD per day.  With this income, she supports the daily needs of her family.  Chenda is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking this loan to pay for the tuition fee for her husband who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree specializing in Law. She hopes that her husband can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her husband.

loans.name: Mokongoche B Group

texts.en:
Mokongoche B is a Nuru International group of two farmers in the Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Mokongoche collectively guarantee the loan.

Rael, who is holding a piece of paper on her hand, is the Chairperson and has been a member of the group since 2012.  She is 36 years old and is married with five children, three of whom go to school. 

The loan from KIVA will enable Rael to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will enable her obtain high yields. Just like other members of her group, Rael will take input loans for one acre. She plans to grow maize in 1/2 an acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. Rael plans to sell the surplus and obtain money to contribute paying school fees for her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and a mother of four children. They all live in a three bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced some challenges in life, a few to mention are the sickness and loss of her pigs and poverty to start up a business.

With this new loan she has requested, she will invest in buying sewing materials, fertilizer and farm seedling.  She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and furthermore, she has been trained on sewing and farm work. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate price selling, providing food and clothing for a rapidly increasing population.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family's needs; ensure her children's education and; provide food for the family. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.  Also social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy material, fertilizer and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en: Mukimjon is a young and hardworking man. He is 22 years old. Mukimjon is not married and lives with his parents. He was in the army for 2 years. Recently he came back. Now, he must earn a living as his parents are pensioners. Mukimjon is a master of repairing houses. He knows his craft well. For the winter season there are fewer repairs required which is why Mukimjon wants to organize an additional business of a taxi service. He does not own a car. Mukimjon is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car for organizing his new business.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarrina was born in 1979. She is a smart and kind woman. She has a higher education and is a teacher in a school. She teaches biology. Zarrina has worked in this field for more than 3 years. She has 3 children. Zarrina has always wanted to make a living. She has a small salary which is why she has not had the opportunity to buy jewellery for her children. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy jewellery for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy jewellery for her children.

loans.name: Abed Al Wahid

texts.en:
Abed Al Wahid is a 59-year-old married father of three children who has been selling fruit juices and cocktails since May 2013, to make his living and cover his family's expenses.

Abed Al Wahid is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special desserts that will attract new customers and will increase his income, especially during the coming Holy christmas celebrations where people seek such tasty things.
Abed Al Wahid hopes to keep on developing his business through diversifying his products and expanding his working zone.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special desserts in addition to fruit juices and cocktails.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the region of Hoima in Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past five years, Rogers has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells beer, wine, spirits and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Rogers has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, sodas, spirits, and water, and will help Rogers to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Rogers hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Rogers is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rogers who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, sodas, spirits, and water.

loans.name: Nanyanga's Group

texts.en:
Bakholera Alala is a group of 6 group leader farmers in the Busia District with Nanyanga selected as the Kiva representative.  Nanyanga has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 50 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Nanyanga is 43 years old and has been a farmer for 20years.  Nanyanga works as a farmer to provide for her 7 children.  The community and other farmers know Nanyanga as friendly, hardworking, reliable and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community activities such as the women's group, prayer group and the burial committee.  Nanyanga described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
							
Nanyanga first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Nanyanga joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Nanyanga plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Nanyanga’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.  							
Nanyanga and the Bakholera Alala Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.
