She has been running her business for many years now, which has allowed her to gain experience in sales and earn better profits. Her store is located in her home, which is in a location where a lot of people pass by. She says she is well known among the neighbors of her area, and that she has gained many customers because she keeps her store well stocked.

Sara would like to make a new investment in her business and to grow it, but she needs capital. She is requesting this loan to buy beans, bread, soup, candy, soft drinks, coffee and instant products. She promises to pay back the loan, which she believes will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, bread, soup, candy, soft drinks, coffee and instant products.

loans.name: Sofia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sofía de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Doña Sofía  solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y así seguir elaborando las tortillas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Sofía, 57, has made a living for several years selling tortillas in her home.  She works from Monday through Sunday.  She has a lot of customers because she's a very hardworking and friendly person.  With her profits she's able to pay the household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her family.

Sofía's requesting a loan to buy quintals of corn so she can continue making tortillas because this is her only source of income.  This way she'll earn better profits to have greater economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn

loans.name: Sherybel

texts.en:
Sherybel is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a driver and the couple is blessed with three children. For the past three years, Sherybel has sold vegetables in her village and she earns a net income of 200 PHP each day. 

Sherybel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplant, Chinese cabbage, and bottle gourds. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and she will continuously increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant, Chinese cabbage, and bottle gourds to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 52 years old and widowed with seven children. With three children still in school, Ma. Cecelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cecelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, bread, sugar, salt, milk, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Cecelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
With her desire to help her husband in meeting their expenses, Crisanta engages in a food business. She sells snack foods, breads and drinks, and for extra profits, she also sells cooked food. 

Crisanta wants to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stock of beverages, raw meat, and raw ingredients. She hopes that their living conditions will continue to improve and her business will continue earning more profits for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stock of beverages, raw meat, and raw ingredients.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Malo is 31 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Malo has a general store business in the Philippines. Malo requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Malo has been in this business for four years. In the future, Malo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna appreciates the previous loan because it helped her to buy cereals for sale. She is taking another loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her stock by buying grains of rice, maize, wheat and beans for sale. She thanks Kiva and Yehu at large for the support.

loans.use: to buy grains of rice, maize, wheat and beans for sale.

loans.name: Vines

texts.en:
Vines is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She works selling fruit and vegetables.

Vines is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other vegetables to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest into her business. Vines is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Maria Ada

texts.en:
Maria Ada is 37 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Maria Ada works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Ada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like toothpaste, fabric conditioner, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Maria Ada has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, fabric conditioner, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

Maria Ada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like toothpaste, fabric conditioner, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her handicraft business.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years. Maria earns additional income from a general store.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marichu has been in this business for 5 years. Marichu earns additional income from a general store.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more stock of groceries such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries like wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mbyuta

texts.en:
Mbyuta is a hair dresser who has managed to attract many customers to her salon because of her good services. 

The previous loan helped her to buy a blow drier and other items for use in her business.

She comes to you again requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to buy shampoo, conditioner and combs for use in her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner and combs for use in her business.

loans.name: Reginalda's Group

texts.en:
Reginalda’s group has seven farmers and is located in Chwele District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 78 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Reginalda is pictured on the right of the Bidii Group with her hand raised.
							
Reginalda is 51 years old and has been a farmer for 30 years. Reginalda works as a farmer to provide for her two children. The community and other farmers know Reginalda as reliable and trustworthy.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in the women's group and prayer group. Reginalda described her harvest last year as good, but she hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Reginalda first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Reginalda joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member.  Reginalda plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Reginalda’s own life was improved because she has more profits from her harvest, and was able to save money and feed the family. 

Reginalda and the Bidii Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet or sorghum.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
Voeurn is 52 years old and a mother of four children. She lives in Kandal provinc,e where she grows her paddy rice as the main source of income. She has been involved in this business for years. 

She is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With this loan, she will pay for her daughter's school fees in university, where she is majoring in finance and banking. 

Voeurn strongly believes that this financial support will respond to the financial demand of her daughter so that her daughter can pay more attention in her study and perform well. As a result, her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's school fees in university.

loans.name: Martin's Group

texts.en:
Martin’s group has eight farmers and is located in Chwele District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 76 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Martin is pictured on the right of the Toloso Group with his hand raised.	
						
Martin is married and has eight children.  He is 46 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy.  He is active in his community in groups such as the prayer group.  Martin has been a farmer for 30 years. 
  							
Martin is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Martin joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family. Martin has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Martin's life because he has more farm training.  In the future, Martin hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school. 

Martin and the Toloso Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
This is Rosemary. She appreciates the financial support for her business from Kiva and Yehu that has enabled her get additional profits that she used to purchase men's shoes for her business.

She is requesting a loan of KES 100,000 to purchase more shoes and bales of clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 38 years old and a housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three sons and three daughters. Her husband has owned a hotel (restaurant) for 10 years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Yasmeen, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase materials like flour, rice, pulses, vegetables, etc.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for flour, rice, pulses, etc., for the hotel (restaurant).

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is 29 years old, a hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons, and three daughters. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For five years, Rafia has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Rafia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too much congested. 

She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo credits his veteran father as his inspiration for continuing the family cleaning business that caters to military offices and family homes. Oswaldo’s father operated the Ultra Fast Maid for 10 years until his passing in 2012, forcing the business to close. Working as a contractor for the Department of the Defense in Virgina at the time, Oswaldo decided that he owed it to his father to return to California and reopen the company.

After reopening the business in 2013, Oswaldo used his prior connections with the Navy to rebuild his client base throughout San Diego County. Competition for cleaning companies in military complexes is very competitive and all contractors are required to go through extensive federal background checks. However, with the personal recommendation from the admiral who oversaw his contracting work in Virginia, Oswaldo was able to secure permission to serve many of the local military housing complexes in the area.

What Oswaldo loves most about his work is how he gets involved with other people, particularly other small business owners trying to make a living. He also offers disabled military veterans preferred client discounts as he believes that “there are certain people we’ve just got to give back to sometimes.”

Oswaldo plans to use his $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase new cleaning equipment and tires for the company vehicle and to print employee business cards. 

He currently has four employees and is looking to hire two more part-time employees in the near future. He also plans to expand his services, offering painting and power washing to his clients. He hopes that his business will continue to grow, allowing him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning equipment and tires for the company vehicle and print employee business cards.

loans.name: Amal Al-Zahoor Group

texts.en:
Khamisa is 41 years old and has been selling fabric and clothes in her region for five years. She is the leader of the Amal Al-Zahoor loan group, which consists of four women who are friends from the same village. The women are residents of Hodeida, Yemen.

The Amal Al-Zahoor group is requesting a 80,000 YER loan from AMB to increase member business activity levels. Khamisa will use her 20,000 YER portion of the group loan to buy a supply of fabric to meet her customer needs and increase her volume and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric to meet customer needs

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly; because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shaheen is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is the age of 53, and is living in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art; he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, joiner and a level, which have become worn out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy the described tools. 

Therefore, Bashiran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her son can buy the tools for his construction work. Bashiran thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for her son to provide construction services.

loans.name: Al-Hadil Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hadil and consists of four members. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. 

Khadra is 37 years old and is the leader of the group. She sells sweets and ice cream. She has been doing this for 13 years. She says that she began this business when she felt her husband wasn't able to cover all the expenses of his family. She is hardworking, and through effort and dedication, has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. 

She is asking for a loan of 70,000 YER (Yemeni rials) from AMB to buy sweets and ice cream in order to be able to continue her business. She is working toward increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy sweets and ice cream in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 34-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband started his own business of selling welding material eight years ago. Shumaila is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, welding rods so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Shumaila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, welding rods.

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda is 42 years old and is a married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own clothing business eight years ago. 

Saeeda, as a member of a two-persons lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply so that he can offer more variety to the customers. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Saeeda hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Al-Brah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Brah and consists of five ladies who live in Hodeidh,Yemen. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB. 

Saada is from Hodiedh, Yemen. She is 35 years old and is a married woman. She is the only provider in the family. She started her business because it was a good way to make money, as she needs to provide for her family. She has been selling clothing and perfumes for four years. She has accumulated good experience in this field and a good reputation in her local community. 

She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB to buy clothing, perfumes, etc. She states that this loan will be of help because she will be able to buy varied merchandise to invest in her clothing business. This will increase her sales, generating greater earnings at the same time. She has future plans of making improvements to her house to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes and other goods to expand her business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is taking a loan of $700 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (coca cola, sagiko, sprite, fanta), noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, fish, slippers, books, pencils, bread and water. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Amigo Group

texts.en:
The group Amigo is composed of three Filipino men who have been friends ever since they came to Lebanon. They all work as chefs in Lebanese restaurants. 

Richard is the group leader and the featured member sitting at the far left side of the picture. He is a 39-year-old married father whose family is still living in the Philippines. His wife is unemployed, which makes him the main and only financial provider of the family.
 
He and his group members are acquiring this loan to satisfy their beloved families' increasing needs. His loan from Al Majmoua will be sent to his beloved family back in the Philippines to make sure that they will have the chance to celebrate a delightful Christmas like anyone else must do during this holy season.

Doroteo is the man sitting in the middle of the picture, and Emiego Jr. is the man sitting at the right of the picture. Both of them will also send their part of the loan to their families for the same reason, and they all hope that soon they will be capable of uniting back with their beloved ones and starting their own businesses in their hometown.

loans.use: to send the money to his beloved family back in the Philippines.

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur ZOUMANA  est marié et âgé de 46 ans. Il est  père de 11enfants et  vit dans une famille polygame avec ses deux épouses, ses enfants et ses parents à Ouelessebougou.
Il mène cette activité  de boucher depuis maintenant 20 ans et compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de quatre bœufs à abattre pour satisfaire sa demande journalière qui s’accroît, il vend sur  place au marché à une clientèle constituée de femmes de  ménages et de restaurateurs.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 200.000 FCFA ; monsieur  ZOUMANA est à son huitième prêt et désire  à la longue construire  une boucherie moderne avec le programme de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso /Kiva.
texts.en:
Mr. ZOUMANA is 46 years old and a married father of eleven children. He lives in a polygamous family with his two wives, children, and parents in Ouelessebougou. He has been running a butcher shop for twenty years now and intends to use this loan to purchase four head of cattle to slaughter in order to satisfy the growing daily demand. He makes his sales locally to a customer base composed of housekeepers and restauranteurs at the market. He plans on making an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA. 

Mr. ZOUMANA is on his 8th loan and would like to build a modern butcher shop over time with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso/ Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena did not finish her studies because she married at a young age. Despite not being a degree holder, she did not stop reaching for her dreams and  she strives to provide a better way of living for their five children. 

Elena manages her general store where she sells garments, kitchen wares, footwear and grocery items in her stall. 

Due to lack of capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy clothes, short pants, slippers, shoes and grocery items to sell. She will always reserve her earnings for her children to help them in attaining their college educations and becoming professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy clothes, short pants, slippers, shoes and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is in her sixties and still single. She spends her time managing her retailing business while taking care of her nephews and niece. Erlinda sells grocery items and is into mobile loading for additional income. She mentioned that her relatives abroad send her a monthly allowance but she wants to strive on her own because she does not want to always rely on them. Erlinda wishes for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy grocery items and mobile loads to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and mobile loads to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya, 58 years old, is married with two children from the province of Isabela. She is engaged in selling vegetable and fruits in the community. She is asking for a loan amounting PHP 20,000 to buy a variety of fruits and vegetable to offer in the community to earn additional income so that she can sustain the daily necessities of her family. Ligaya hopes to get this amount of a loan to have a better way of living and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetable such as bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Melsi

texts.en:
Melsi is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Soleman, a 32-year-old man. They have a son namely Septiani Julio Dethan, who is 1 year old.
 
Melsi has been running a kiosk business since 2005. With the capital amount of IDR 5,000,000, she bought snacks, soft drinks, and other daily basic needs. She also sometimes sells fresh fish when the weather is good.

At the moment, Melsi requested an individual loan amount of 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on eggs to sell at her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell at her kiosk.

loans.name: Iderlina

texts.en: Iderlina is 56 years old and married. She has four children. She operates a retail store, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She would like to keep improving her sales but has insufficient funds to buy more merchandise to sell. With regards to her situation, Iderlina is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy candies, eggs, breads, sardines and noodles to sell. Iderlina promises to pay back her loan in full and keep maintaining good sales from her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, eggs, breads, sardines and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn is a 19-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She earns a living by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like shampoo, mosquito killer, soap, noodles and canned goods. Her business started three years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, pellets (pig feed) and and various groceries, to maintain the inventory of store and also attract more customers.

In the future, Jerelyn  hopes to expand her  sari-sari (variety) store business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy rice, pellets (pig feed) and and various groceries.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has run a general store for many years, earning well for the family. She had a good profit from her business and she successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to improve the business. 

In order to enhance her store, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to support her children in school and see them finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Floriza

texts.en:
Floriza helps her husband earning a living with her buy-and-sell business. She sells her charcoal in the market and she earns good returns from it.

To buy more coconut shells, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit, which she had joined this last year. She wants to improve the general living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Meet Joyce. She is a farmer and a mother of six children who lives in Nyamira, a banana growing area. Joyce has been farming for the past 30 years and she earns an income from selling rabbit meat, milk, tea, and bananas. She loves rearing rabbits because it gives her the most profit. Joyce’s major business challenge is insufficient funds. She chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan because they offer better services to low income earners and their interest rates are low. Joyce says that Juhudi Kilimo has enlightened her on the importance of saving.

Joyce is requesting a loan to buy supplies to farm rabbits. Her loan will increase her profit that she will use to make ends meet, give her children a good education, and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy supplies to farm rabbits

loans.name: Ma. Veaniza

texts.en:
Ma. Veaniza works hard to support her family. Ma. Veaniza is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Ma. Veaniza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ma. Veaniza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 48 years old and married with two children. Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Melanie has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers, sugar, juice, toothpaste, etc. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 32 years old and widowed. Merlita works very hard to provide.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like snack foods, toothpaste, shampoo, hair conditioner, etc., to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, toothpaste, shampoo, hair conditioner, etc. In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like snack foods, toothpaste, shampoo, hair conditioner, etc., to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 32 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines.

Amalia  is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She has been farming sugarcane for four years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Neila

texts.en:
Neila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Neila requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Neila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan appreciates her previous Kiva loan that enabled her to purchase more furniture for her school.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase pens, books and chalk for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase pens, books and chalk for her business.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en: Kanze is very grateful for her Kiva loan funds that have improved her living standards. She is now requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase five sacks of coconuts and to pay for transportation costs for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of coconuts and to pay for transportation costs for her business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou avait déjà entamé une activité commerciale avant d’aller rejoindre son domicile conjugal il y a 12 ans de cela. En ce moment, elle vendait des divers. Divorcée, elle est rentrée dans sa région natale où elle s’est remariée et a redémarré il y a moins d’un an, une activité qu’est la vente de petit déjeuner devant chez elle. Elle travaille de 7h 30mn à 12h.
Fatou est une cliente régulière et a déjà eu à bénéficier de cinq crédits au sein de l’IMCEC. Elle veut renouveler pour aménager un peu le lieu de l’activité, acheter des tasses, des verres, des plats…
Fatou a 3 enfants dont le plus âgé a 11 ans. Fatou donne sa participation à la gestion de la maison en donnant le petit déjeuner.
Fatou a un projet, celui d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de divers (habillement, vaisselles).
texts.en:
Fatou had already started a business prior to joining her marital home twelve years ago. At that time, she sold various sundries. After divorcing, she returned to her hometown where she has remarried and restarted a business selling breakfast in front of her home, which she has been doing for less than a year. She works from 7:30 am to 12:00 pm.

Fatou is a regular client, and has already received and benefitted from five loans through IMCEC. She wants to renew her loan so that she can improve her place of business by purchasing cups, glasses, plates...

Fatou has three children, the eldest of whom is eleven years old. Fatou helps with the management of household expenses by selling breakfasts. Fatou has a project where she would like to open a shop and sell various items, including clothing and dishes.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables (onions, peppers, chilies), for sauces called "condiments," and to improve her place of business by purchasing cups, glasses, plates...

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen, 43, is from a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Pursat province. She is married and has five children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and sometimes they work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day and she can save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
This is her first microloan with VisionFund, and she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Theng is 72 years old, a married woman who has five grown children. 

She runs an agricultural business growing rice and has been doing this for more than 21 years. With her earnings, Theng is able to pay for food and cover other costs of living. Theng is photographed in the photo with her husband in front of their latrine.

Since Theng doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. Therefore, she has requested a loan of USD 2,000 to build a household latrine. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Theng to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a member of Khalundu Group in Chwele District. He is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group l farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 94 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Patrick has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Patrick is married and has 16 children. He is 60 years old and is known as hardworking. He is active in his community in groups such as the prayer group. Patrick has been a farmer for 32 years. Patrick described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Patrick first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Patrick joined One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Patrick plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Patrick’s own life was improved because he has more farm training. 

Patrick and the Khalundu Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 41 years old from the small village of Khobi district. She has a husband, two daughters, two granddaughters and a pensioner mother-in-law. Her husband is provided with an invalid pension of 150 GEL per month. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a cow and 2 calves. Inga milks the cow every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, the family has 2.5 hectare of agricultural land, where nut trees and laurel leaves are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. 

Inga decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to start her business. With the loan, she will purchase household goods and will resell them at higher prices to generate income. Inga will be involved in her own business and will provide better living conditions to her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling household goods.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is a 52-year-old married man, who lives in Samtredia. He has a mother, wife and son. Tariel's mother gets monthly assistance from the local government; his wife and son are unemployed at this moment. The family's primary source of income is Tariel's work transporting cargo as taxi driver, sawing firewood and cutting grass in the squares. His monthly income is approximately 350 GEL, however this is not enough to meet the basic needs of his family. 

Tariel wants somehow to improve his family's living conditions and to start doing another activity in parallel to the work he already has. He requested 3,000 USD to buy firewood and start selling it using his own car. 

Tariel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start-up program gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Tariel and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and start selling it.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
A villager from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Vy is 44 years old and a mother of one little child. 

To earn a living, she works at a local factory. It is an occupation that she has had for one year and it has returned her for almost USD 4 per day. 

Vy is a third-time borrower with Vision Fund (Kiva's partner). She has repaid her past loans with success. For this cycle, she is taking out a new loan in order to start a new business of growing mushrooms. She hopes that this new business will return her a good income so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To start a mushroom-growing business.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Agd 37, Neang is a married mother of three children living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. 

To support her family, Neang has been farming rice and planting cassava for 19 years in the village. The current business earns her about 48,000 KHR per day.
 
Neang’s group consists of two members and she is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use some of her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and a portion of it to renovate her old house. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is age 44, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturers or brands and sells them in his shop. 

He has been selling gents shoes only, but now he wants to offer joggers as well to meet customers' demands. The major problem is the lack of funds.
 
Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to buy joggers to sell. Naseem is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy joggers to sell in the shoe shop of her husband.

loans.name: Al-Mask Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Mask and it is made up of five women who are natives of Hodeida, Yemen.  One of the members of this group is Wahba, who is 30 years old. She has had a business selling clothes. She is a married woman and has children. She is a professional in this field and her goods are required in the market. She realized that her business was profitable and she set out to invest more in it. Now, she is applying for a loan of YER 50,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy additional clothes to expand her business. She hopes to have a clothing shop to expand her business. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is a 35-year-old married woman from Senaki district. She lives with her husband and two children who go to the local school. Nowadays the family has no source of income. Their relatives help them to cover everyday costs. 

Shorena decided to start trading clothes and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 2,000 to begin her trading business. 

She will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and resell at higher price to generate income. She is very motivated to be involved in her own business and provide elementary living conditions for her children. Shorena awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes.

loans.name: Al-Raba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Raba and is comprised of three women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The head of the group is 36-year-old Farja, who works selling sweets and games. She  began the business with small capital and, thanks to sacrifice and hard work, she has been able to grow and continually improve her business.

She applied for a loan that she will use to buy more sweets and games to sell and in this way will increase her working capital and improve her business.  She would like to use the profits to raise her family's quality of life. She hopes to expand her business into a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more sweets and games to sell

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 23-year-old, vigorous woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and she uses the generated income to support her entire family. She has been using a manual machine, but now she wants to buy a professional sewing machine which works through electricity, so she can sew clothing rapidly and on time.

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, Saba is unable to buy a new sewing machine. For this reason, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

Saba intends to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine, to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She is from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district.  She and her husband have been planting pineapple for 10 years. To earn additional income, they work for others for a fee. Together, they earn about 60,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sorm is requesting a loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She is the leader of Sorn's Group. She hopes to raise more pineapples and sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: maria de 42 años posee un pequeño chalet ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia donde vende golosinas, refrescos, agua, gaseosa, etc. con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda en el hogar, Maria esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y surtir aun mas su negocio ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo ´para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and owns a small stand close to her home where she sells snacks, drinks, water, and soda.  With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to meet some of her household expenses.  She lives in a house she owns with her son, who works and helps her at home.  

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase more products at wholesale and better stock her business since it is her only source of work.  She wants to earn more profits and have a better quality of life together with her son.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, drinks, water, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es:
Doña Reina es una persona muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y tienen más de 30 años de residir en un Barrio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa al occidente de Honduras. 
Doña Reina  cuenta con una venta de tortillas, la cual tiene en una esquina del solar de su casa de habitación dándole atención a muchos de sus vecinos y personas de lugares cercanos así como también a todos los conductores  que pasan por el lugar ya que es muy transitable. 
Doña Reina quiere adquirir el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más productos como maíz, leña y cal para la elaboración de tortillas  ya que sus clientes  han aumentado y no alcanza a abastecerles bien y quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y así satisfacer su clientela y a la vez poder obtener muchas más ganancias. 
Doña Reina  espera que con este préstamo su negocio pueda abastecer a muchas más personas de su comunidad y de esta manera le genere más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Doña Reina  espera que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y seguir trabajando con este tipo de créditos para en un futuro poder abastecer a muchas más zonas cercanas, su sueño es que su negocio crezca aun más en los próximos años.



Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Diciembre 2013
texts.en:
Doña Reina is a very hard worker who has lived with her husband for over 30 years in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa neighborhood in western Honduras.

Doña Reina relies on the sale of tortillas from a corner of the site of her house which catches the attention of many of her neighbors and people in nearby locations as well as all the drivers passing by the place (as it is very passable).  She hopes to acquire this loan to invest in the purchase of more products such as corn, wood and lime for making tortillas because her customers have increased and she is unable to supply them well.  She wants to be able to fulfill her customers' orders and in so doing satisfy her clientele and at the same time obtain greater profits.

Doña Reina hopes that with this loan her business can serve many more people in her community and in this way generate more revenue to improve the living conditions of her family.  She expects that her business can continue to grow and that she will continue working with this type of credit so that in the future she will be able to serve many more nearby areas.  Her dream is to grow her business even more in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 28 years of age, married and has been blessed with two children. She lives simply within her locality.

Bernadette manages her retail store, raises hogs and buys and sells bananas. 

According to her, she acquires her groceries every week. Now she plans to buy more stocks of grocery items to economize her fare in going to and from the market, but her capital is not sufficient. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan to buy stocks of grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and candies. 

She knows that this loan will enable her to obtain her goals in her family and with the business she operates. Bernadette is looking forward to the approval of her requested loan amount to keep her business productive and profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and candies for her retail store.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is 58 years old. She lives with her husband and her three daughters in Gaza. Her daughters attend the public primary school. Sameera works with her husband in a small grocery shop.

Sameera is asking Ryada for this loan to paint her house and to install doors and windows, which will help to warm her house, especially now in the winter. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her. 

Her husband appears in the photo for her. For cultural reasons, she can’t publish her photo online, so she apologizes.

loans.use: to paint her house and to install doors and windows

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam operates a greengrocer shop. She has been earning 20,000 KES each month. She has used her savings to buy a motorcycle for her spouse to use in transportation to generate extra income. 

Miriam is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of assorted vegetables to sell. This will be her second loan. Miriam hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business, educate her children, and repay her loan. In the future, she hopes to be economically stable.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is married with two children. Her husband works as a carpenter to make a living. Genalyn works managing a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation and rentals. She has been renting out her motorcycle for more than a year and she earns good enough profit to meet her family’s daily needs. 

Genalyn is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires for her motor. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen owns and manages a general store selling assorted groceries to make a living. She has been in this business for more than eight years and is able to support her family's needs. From her profit, she also was able to successfully repay her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to improve her business. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She plans to expand her business and send her children to school so that they can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: Le Client Eli est un agent dans une entreprise commerciale d’énergie. Il est parent des  3 étudiants  à l’université. Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais d’éducation supérieures par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ses étudiants en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent  rêve voir ses enfants devenir ingénieur architecte,   ingénieur en génie civil, chef d’entreprise. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant dédié à l’éducation de leurs enfants en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Eli. is a representative at a private energy enterprise and the parent of three university students. He was informed about new opportunities at Hekima to finance higher education. Thus, this new loan will be used to pay for the education costs for his students, so that they are no longer excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 academic year. This parent dreams of seeing his children become an architect-engineer, a civil engineer, and a manager of a company. 

He thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for its new innovative product providing loans with social impact, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to pay for the education costs for his children at university.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a farmer living in Nyamira with her two children who are of school-going age.

She has been doing farming for four years, producing and selling milk, eggs, tea and bananas. She says that increasing poultry would mean increasing her income level, but her challenge is having limited funds.

Dinah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loans are repayable at an affordable interest rate so that she can add up her assets. She loves the way Juhudi helps small-scale farmers do their business.

This loan will enable her to finance her poultry project, which in turn will bring in more income. This will enable her to provide for her family better and also to give her children better education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is 29 years old and married with one kid. For the past five years, she has been farming sugarcane and rice in the Philippines. Dona also earns additional income from running a general store. 

Dona is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Neresa

texts.en:
Neresa is 53 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. For the past four years, she has been a dressmaker in the Philippines. Neresa is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Neresa is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fabric, buttons, zippers, and other items for her dressmaking business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other items

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 51 years old, married, and has eight children.

Emelda works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items for her store.

Emelda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Emelda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items for her store

loans.name: Pacienca

texts.en:
Pacienca is married and works hard to support her family. For 21 years now, she has operated a handicraft business in the Philippines. 

Pacienca has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials such as shells, etc. for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana, 58 years old, lives with her husband in Gori district. Manana sells fruits; she purchase them from the wholesalers and then resells at higher prices to generate income. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Manana has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3,500 to purchase a car that will enable her husband to serve local people as a taxi driver. the resulting increased income will help the family improve their living conditions. 

Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
Aferdita is a married mother of two boys, ages three and five years old. Her husband works in construction and she is a housewife, taking care of their children. They all live in a minority Ashkali community in a very old, small house. She has always wanted to build a new house because there is not enough space for them for them to live comfortably and no place for the children to be able to use for studying.  

Aferdita is requesting a loan to build an annex onto her house in order to expand the living area, helping them to improve their living conditions. She hopes in the future to be able to offer a better life to her family and give their children a better education. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To build an annex in her house in order to expand the living area

loans.name: Rasif

texts.en:
Rasif is 59 years old and married with three children. For the past six years, he has been providing welding services. He takes orders to make gates, doors, and small stoves that he sells at the market due to high demand. This is the only source of income in Rasif`s family. He used his previous Kiva loan to open his own workshop.

Rasif is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase materials to meet the demand of his customers. His loan will help to make his business successful and provide all of his children with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to meet customer demand

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 25-year-old married mother of two children. Since 2008, she has been raising sheep as well as planting and selling tobacco plants.  Rajaa has overcome slight obstacles since beginning her business with her brother. She used to be afraid of animals which mad her work very hard to do. Rajaa has gotten used to animals and things have turned out easier for her.

Rajaa is requesting a youth loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to maintain her animal barn before the upcoming winter season to avoid ceiling leakage and keep it a healthy place. She hopes that in the future she'll be capable of starting her own business other than raising animals to support her family.

loans.use: to maintain her animal barn before the upcoming winter season to keep it dry and healthy

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is 34 years old and single. She lives with her parents and is a very good entrepreneur. Konul sells office supplies in her store such as tape, calculators, bulbs and other items. Even though her store is small, she has a lot of customers.  Konul is a positive woman and she works the whole day without resting. Her profit is 100 AZN. As you can see in this photo, there are very few products in Konul’s store as she does not have enough funds to buy goods. She has borrowed three previous loans from Agroinvest.

Konul is requesting a 1,400 AZN loan to buy more goods and invest in her business. This will be her fourth loan. Konul believes her loan will have a positive effect on her business and allow her to expand.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq  is  23  years old, single and works hard to earn an income by selling groceries. He is well-known in his neighborhood, where he provides people with canned foods, snacks, dairy products, juices, and drinks. He has two years of experience in this field and gained it by working with his father ever since he was a 17. Sadiq wants to improve his store, and to do that he needs a loan 600 AZN. He will use this loan to buy a new generator and install some new shelves. He believes that this loan will help him keep his dairy products fresh and better satisfy his customers. This will allow him to improve his reputation and expand his store.

loans.use: to buy a new generator.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther's previous loan improved her living standards by enabling her to expand her business and earn a higher income, which she used to establish a dress making school.

Esther is requesting another loan from Yehu for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es: Don benigno se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus dos  hijos. Benigno está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Benigno has made a living in agriculture growing beans and corn for several years.  With the sales from his harvests he's able to pay the household expenses.  He lives with his wife and two children and is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man.  

Benigno's requesting a loan to buy inputs for his harvest such as fertilizer, soil amendments, seeds, and so on.

What he earns isn't enough to cover these expenses, so this way he'll have more income and better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, canchos para el cabello entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y sus hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicta un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, etc. ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solictada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su famili lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna
texts.en:
The client sells various types of products for personal use such as lotions, deodorants, hair clips among other items. Her business is located in her home. With the earnings from her business and with her husband’s help she manages to pay household expenses. She lives in a rented house with her husband and their children. 

Her clients want her to increase her business and that is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase all the things she needs: perfume, nail polish, deodorants etc... Since she has many clients she can sell her products at affordable prices. 

With the requested loan she will be able to obtain better profits and thus continue providing for her family, giving them what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions etc...

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José ramón tiene la edad de 30 años, con su esposa procrearon un hijo quien es su principal motor para  salir adelante, es docente en una universidad pública en el departamento de antropología, su rama profesional, actualmente estudia una maestría en ciencias del desarrollo rural,  puesto  que en su centro de trabajo están exigiendo mayor preparación a los docente, es por eso que José Ramón busca la manera de superar su nivel académico, por este motivo solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de dicha maestría, así podrá mejorar su economía familiar, enriquecer sus conocimientos y contribuir a la sociedad.
texts.en:
José Ramón is 30 years old. He and his wife have a son who is his main reason to come out ahead. He is a teacher at a public university in the Anthropology Department, his specialization. He is now studying for his Master's Degree in Science of Rural Development. Since his workplace demands more training for teachers, this is why José Ramón is looking to increase his academic level. 

This is why he is requesting a loan, in order to pay for the Master’s Degree. This way he can improve his family’s financial situation, enrich his knowledge and contribute to society.

loans.use: to pay for a Master's Degree program.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un negocio de lavado de carros desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela pues da un buen servicio y a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de jabon, esponjas, pasta para brillo, etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo, y poder seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives in a house he owns with his family.  He has owned a business washing cars for many years.  He has many customers since he gives them good service and a good price.  With the income he earns from his work, he helps with the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase soap, sponges, car wax, and other items so that he can continue with his work since this is his only source of income.  He can continue helping his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sponges, car wax, and other items.

loans.name: Nohelia Margarita

texts.es: Nohelia  tiene 22 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Lic. en contabilidad pública y finanzas, su anhelo es culminar con éxitos sus estudios y poder  encontrar un empleo más rápido, ya que sin título le es difícil optar por un puesto laboral, en la actualidad Nohelia cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir sus gastos universitarios y del hogar. Este apoyo de crédito que solicita, es para pagar el curso de titulación de su profesión, de esta forma Nohelia busca la manera de salir adelante junto a su esposo y estar preparados para cuando lleguen los hijos, para brindarles una vida digna.
texts.en:
Nohelia is 22 years old.  She is studying for a degree in public accounting and finance.  Her goal is to finish her studies successfully and be able to find a job quickly, since without her degree it is difficult to find a job.  Currently Nohelia has the support of her husband to cover her university fees and the household expenses.  

She is requesting this loan to pay for her degree granting course.  Nohelia is looking for a way to move forward together with her husband so that when they have children, they can provide them with a good life.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is forty-one years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jessica is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jessica has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita más capital por la facilidad que le proporciona para comprar 12 quintales de maíz, que le servirán continuar trabajando sin limitantes por un tiempo en el negocio de venta de tortillas.
Para Rosa ha sido de mucho beneficio el crédito que se le facilito anteriormente, pues sus ventas son mejores, tiene nuevos clientes y su economía ha mejorado en gran medida, lo que le permite dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en: Rosa seeks more capital to provide for the ease of purchasing 12 bushels of corn which will help her to continue working without limitations for a time in the business of selling tortillas.  For Rosa, the previous loans have been of great benefit because her sales are better, she has new customers and her economic situation has greatly improved.  This has allowed her to give a better life to her family and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bushels of corn.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a hardworking woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle business and she also runs a boutique where she sells various women’s clothing. Irine’s major business challenges are motorcycle breakdowns and muddy roads during the rainy season. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

Irine is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle and more bales of clothing for her boutique. In the future, she dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle and bales of clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Perpetua has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like lotion, shampoo, bath soap, detergent soap and other groceries to sell.

Perpetua would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like lotion, shampoo, bath soap, detergent soap and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 27 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing and raising pigs.

Marilyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet business in the Philippines.

Socorro requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to pay for internet and electric bills and cover spare parts for the maintenance of her computers. She has been in this business for six years now.

Socorro would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for internet and electric bills and cover spare parts for the maintenance of her computers

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
Amani is a group of seven group leader farmers in Chwele District with David, in the phot with his hand raised, selected as the Kiva representative.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 74 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
David is 70 years old, married, and has seven children.  He is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy.  He is active in his community groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  David has been a farmer for five years.  He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
David first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  David joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family, and send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  David plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  David’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  David and the Amani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take a further loan to buy more noodles, meat and other ingredients to make meals to sell from her stall. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different food to make better dishes to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take a further loan to buy many kinds of noodles and other food to sell from her stall. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of noodles and food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Joffrey

texts.en: Joffrey needs capital to purchase compost, fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the rent for the land where he farms. With this purchase, he will have what he needs to plant without any problem. With the previous loan, he had the necessary agricultural inputs to have an abundant harvest and quality grains. His financial situation improved and he continues contributing to improvements in his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the rent for the land where he farms.

loans.name: Cingiz

texts.en: Cingiz is 55 years old, married and the father of four children. He began working as a merchant a year ago, and now sells many different things: dishes, plates, buckets, furnaces and fancy goods. He would like to increase revenues from his business and improve the living conditions of his children so that he can give them a better life. Cingiz is requesting a loan for 500 AZN to buy more industrial and household goods from a wholesaler that he can sell in his store.
