Her mother is the person responsible for her and her child and for her own expenses. The truth is Margarita doesn't want to abandon her dream. She hopes people can help her and she is sincerely grateful.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two school-going kids. She operates a business selling clothing from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma lives with her family in a rental house with electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Her greatest business challenge is the lack of capital to expand. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bales of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es:
Filomeno y su esposa viven en casa propia con sus 4 hijos en la zona San felipe de Seke de la ciudad de El Alto, Filomeno trabaja como maestro albañil en la ciudad de el alto.
Filomeno necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir. Comprará materiales como estuco, arena,ladrillos y se ahorrará la mano de obra.

El sueño de Filomeno es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión, subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Filomeno and his wife live in their own home with their four children in the San Felipe de Seke zone of El Alto.  Filomeno works as a master bricklayer in El Alto.
Filomeno needs the loan to be able to repair his house and offer his children a better place to live.  He will purchase materials like plaster, sand and brick, and he will save up for the labor costs. 

Filomeno's hope is to provide his children with sufficient foundation and education for them to be able to practice a profession and survive in an ever more competitive environment and therefore improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, plaster, and sand to repair his home.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1979 году. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Лола воспитывает своих детей сама. Ее дети не совершеннолетние и учатся в средней школе. Старшему 13 лет и младшему 11 лет. Лола 5 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес изготовлением и продажей национального блюдо «курутоб». Она с бизнесом справляется отлично. Лола хочет развевать свой бизнес. Она хочет купить необходимые посуды для своего кафе. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки посуды для развития нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lola is a hardworking woman.  She was born in 1979.  She is divorced and has two children.  Lola is raising her children by herself.  Her children are not of age and attend a secondary school.  The oldest is 13 and the youngest is 11 years old.  Lola started her own business of cooking and selling a national dish "kurutob" five months ago.  She is handling the business excellently.  Lola wants to develop her business.  She wants to buy necessary dishware for her cafe.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars to buy dishware in order to develop her new business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dishware in order to develop her new business

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она в течение многих лет не имела источника дохода. Рано теперь хочет открыть свой бизнес. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация деловых женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. С такой целью она построила магазин. Теперь ей необходимо купить товар. Ее муж помогает ей открыть бизнес. Рано запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rano is a happy woman.  She is married and raising 4 children.  She did not have a source of income for many years.  Rano now wants to open her own business.  She completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women," and received a certificate.  She wants to organize a business of reselling food products.  She built a store to achieve this goal.  Rano is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy food products.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to start a new business

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулу 29 лет, замужем, и в таком молодом возрасте у Айсулу 4 дочки: Алие-9 лет, Аделе -9 лет, Назик -3 года, Алине-2 года. У Айсулу - средне-специальное образование, она домохозяйка, занимается домашним хозяйством и воспитанием детей. По характеру очень пунктуальная, ответственная, добродушная, аккуратная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 лошади, а также в наделе имеется 4,0 ГА земли на котором ежегодно сажают картофель и зерновые культуры. Имеются все условия по содержанию скота. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству, также в качестве дополнительных доходов супруг оказывает услуги грузовых перевозок. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства улучшение благосостояния своей семьи.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 29 years old and married. Even though she is young, she has four daughters: Alie and Adele are nine, Nazik is three, and Aline is two. Aisuluu has a high school education and is a homemaker. She takes care of the household and raises the children. She is very diligent, responsible, kind and careful by nature. Aisuluu raises livestock and plants crops to provide the main source of income for her family. She began nine years ago when she bought cattle for 35,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aisuluu now has four dairy cows, four horses, and four hectares of land for planting potatoes and grains every year. She has everything she needs to take care of the livestock. Her spouse actively helps on the farm and earns additional income providing shipping transportation services. Their monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her farm, Aisuluu asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy more cows. Aisuluu plans to use the profits to invest in more livestock and to save money to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Safania's Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is a group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District, with Safania selected as the Kiva representative. Safania has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 96 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings.							

Safania is 74 years old and has been a farmer for 50. Safania works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children. The community and other farmers know Safania as friendly, hardworking, and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, and prayer group. Safania described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Safania joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Safania joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer, hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed family.  Because he is an active community member, wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Safania has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Safania's life because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, and more farm group support. He also was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, Safania hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, buy a cow, and invest in a business.
 
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Safania and the Tumaini Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

Please note that there are four additional group leaders in this photo that will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia helps her husband work their farm to make a living. She also raises pigs to sell to earn more income for the family. She had joined GDMPC  recently and took out a loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She always finds ways to augment their living and is thankful to GDMPC for leading small entrepreneurs toward success. Virginia wants to improve their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married, and she helps her husband to earn income with her general store. She has been selling assorted groceries in their community to earn a living. 

She had joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan from its microfinance to buy additional grocery goods for sale. 

She is hopeful enough to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman and a mother of two young children, ages 6 and 2. She lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. Emily earns an income through her cosmetic sales.

Emily is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like perfume, cosmetics, toiletries and other items. Through this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. 

Emily hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like perfume, cosmetics, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Punku Mayor De Maras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUNKU MAYOR DE MARAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Maras, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores  ella es casada y tiene 67 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras,la socia vende cebollas,zanahorias,tomates,pepinos y entre otras verduras,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras como cebollas,zanahorias,tomates y pepinos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Punku Mayor de Maras. This bank is located in the district of Maras which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 
One member is Dolores, who is married and 67 years old and has 3 children. She works in her business selling vegetables. She sells onions, carrots, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other vegetables. She works from 8:00am until 4:00pm. She has been doing this for 7 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. 
The other members work in agriculture, selling grains, running a grocery store, and selling animals.
The member is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this loan and promises to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots tomates, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mado, qui lève la main,  est une commerçante, présidente du groupe d’affaires «Mizeituni», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 41 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui 5 étudient et 1 autre qui est encore gosse. La cliente est une vendeuse de sorghos. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Son conjoint est du personnel soignant (Infirmier). Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 4 sacs de sorghos. Dans le futur, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile de conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mado is a businesswoman, who is raising her hand in the picture, is president and member of the "Mizeitun" business group and a dynamic entrepreneur. She is a 41-year-old mother of six children, five of which currently attend school, the one remaining child still being an infant. This client sells sorghum. She sets up her merchandise outside her property, where she knew she would attract customers. Her spouse works in the medical profession as a nurse. She started her business with capital given to her by her husband. Later, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running this business for two years. This new loan will allow her to buy four sacks of sorghum. In the future, she wishes to buy a plot of land, send her children to school and feed them. 
Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the work they do to liberate women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the established banking system, especially during this difficult post-conflict era in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of sorghum

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of coconuts for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 66-year-old established farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya. He is married and has eight children. He has been farming for 30 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables. He enjoys farming, especially growing and selling vegetables. His major challenge is due to seasonal changes and lack of water due to drought.
Charles chose Juhudi Kilimo because it offers a grace period on loans at a low interest rate. He was also encouraged by the testimonies of other farmers who have benefited from these loans. This loan will enable him to purchase water pipes to channel irrigation water to the farm during dry seasons.This will really help him produce and sell more.

loans.use: For purchasing water pipes.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en: Soy, 44, lives in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Soy is a married mother of six children, three of whom are dependent and still in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice while her husband is a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. Having been in this business for 10 years, Soy is able to earn about 34,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Soy has been with VisionFund for one loan. She completely paid back the loan, which has helped her better support her family with enough food. Now, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, Soy is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income in her business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Eustina

texts.en:
Eustina is a hard-working woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Eustina wants to purchase fruits, potatoes, cassava, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, potatoes, cassava, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 24-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2, western rural area, in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is single with one child. 

In 2003, Fatmata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she did not go to school, so she was trained in business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to change her business to a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Hawa, from Waterloo2, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with four children. Her children are currently attending school. 

Hawa runs a local food business. She sells pepper, palm oil, and gari for resale. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business from 9:00am until 4:00pm, six days per week. Hawa says that her business is doing well because, out of the profit, she is able to take care of the family.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari, to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. 

In the future, Hawa plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari, to expand her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years to earn an income. Her customers are primarily women in her community. She is unmarried and lives with her child in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. Her child attends school.

Eunice decided to join Yehu in order to access financial support to improve her business. With the Kshs 25,000 loan she has requested, she will purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners for her salon.

Eunice dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Erlinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Erlinda de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado gracias a la ayuda que sus padres, desgraciadamente su papá falleció y tubo que iniciar a apoyar a su madre, para que en su casa no faltara los ingresos para los gastos del hogar. Ahora esta acompañada, su esposo es agricultor, tienen 2 hijos de 5 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, quienes este año asistirán a la escuela.

Erlinda es agricultora de toda la vida, desde que su padre falleció, inicio junto con su madre a cultivar maíz y frijol, así pudieron asegurar estos granos para que en su casa no hiciera falta la dieta diaria. Hace 10 años se caso y junto a su esposo siembran 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz. El terreno esta ubicado a un kilómetro de su casa y realizan el recorrido en bicicleta, para iniciar con las labores a las seis y media de la mañana y concluir la jornada a las once y media.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar una vaca, con la cual cada año esperan que se vaya reproduciendo para ir aumentando el numero de animales.


El sueño de toda la vida, de Erlinda ha sido tener un pequeño hato de vacas lecheras, ya que fue el sueño de su padre y desgraciadamente no lo pudo lograr; pero ella espera conseguirlo y así iniciar el negocio en la ganadería, también desea tener una yunta de bueyes, para realizar las labores agrícolas con tracción animal. Otro ideal, es que sus hijos lleguen a ser personas de bien y para esto que mejor que darles un buen ejemplo de vida y lo mas importante la educación.
texts.en:
34 year old Erlinda studied until the 7th grade, thanks to help from her parents. Sadly, her father died and she had to start helping her mother so that the family wouldn't lack the income to pay the household expenses. Now she is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 2 children who are 5 and 6 years old and will go to school this year.
Erlinda has been a farmer all her life since her father died. She began with her mother, growing corn and beans. Growing these grains meant that they never lacked for food at home. She got married 10 years ago and, together with her husband, sows 14,000 square meters of corn. The land is located a kilometer away from their house and they make the journey by bicycle to start work at 6:30 in the morning and finish at 11:30.
This loan will be used to buy a cow which they hope to breed every year in order to grow their number of animals. 
Erlinda's lifelong dream has been to have a little herd of milk cows as this was her father's dream and, sadly, he could not achieve it. But she hopes to get there and to start a livestock business. She also wants to have a team of oxen so she can do farm work with animal traction. Another hope is that her children become good people and for this she needs to give them a good example and, most importantly, education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lirije

texts.en:
Lirije is a 53-year-old lady who lives in a very rural village of south-central Albania. It is in the region's tradition that married women dress up in a long skirt and pants at the same time, just like Lirije, yet only in the villages. She is a mother of three children.

Lirije is requesting a loan for the first time to add goats from a good breed to her existing herd. For about 10 years now, she has been selling dairy products to the farmers’ market. Here it is what she said at the interview with the loan officer: “Since birth we were trained to do this type of activity and nothing else. We are not aware of anything else, but livestock/agriculture. Knowing nothing else, we are happy with what we do.”

loans.use: to add some goats from a good breed to the existing herd

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos,  ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old, is a single mother, and lives in a home of her own with her two children.  She has a store where she sells primary needs items such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things and has been doing this for many years, which allows her to have better sales.  Her store is in her home and is very well known by the residents in the area.  She has many customers because she has a very well stocked store, but wants to invest more into it, so she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs for her store.  She is sure that she will be able to pay off the debt and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio vive en la casa de sus Padres en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto. Marco Antonio  trabaja como ayudante de un taller mecánico, por las noches estudia mecánica automotriz  en un instituto de la ciudad de el alto.
Marco Antonio necesita el crédito para compra de una laptop. Así podrá culminar sus estudios con mayor facilidad en el instituto donde estudia.

El sueño de Marco Antonio es ejercer una profesión y tener un taller mecánico propio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Cooperativa area of the city of El Alto.  Marco Antonio works as an assistant in a mechanic’s shop.  In the evenings, he studies automotive mechanics at an institute in the city of El Alto.

Marco Antonio needs the loan to buy a laptop.  This way he will be able to complete his studies more easily at the institute where he is studying.

Marco Antonio’s dream is to practice a profession and to have his own mechanic's shop.  This way he will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to facilitate his automotive mechanics studies.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro y su esposa viven en casa propia con sus 3 hijos en la zona Alto de la Alianza de la ciudad de El Alto, Alejandro trabaja como chofer en una empresa de la misma ciudad, su esposa trabaja como barredor en otra empresa tambien de la misma ciudad.
Alejandro necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir. Debe comprar ladrillos, estuco, cemento, arena y otros materiales.

El sueño de Alejandro es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro and his wife live in their own house with their three children.  They live in the Alto de la Alianza area in the city of El Alto.  Alejandro works as a driver for a company in the same city.  His wife works as a sweeper for another company, which is also in the same city.

Alejandro needs the loan to be able to repair his house and to be able to give his children a better place to live.  He needs to buy bricks, plaster, cement, sand, and other materials.

Alejandro’s dream is to be able to provide his children with support and enough education so that they are able to practice a profession.  He wants this so that they are able to survive in an atmosphere that is more and more competitive.  This way they will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, plaster, cement, sand, and other materials in order to repair his house.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es: Floridalma de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 2 años a la crianza de pollos,  tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, Floridalma esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y asi pode seguir con su trabajo ya que esa su única fuente de trabajo y asi ella y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Floridalma, age 44, has been raising chickens for two years.  She has a lot of customers who prefer her for the good prices.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her child.

Floridalma is requesting a loan from Integral to be able to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens.  This way she will be able to continue with her work because this is her only source of work.  This way she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El señor Alexander, desde hace mas de 5 años tiene su propio negocio, junto a su esposa a luchado por salir adelante, la actividad comercial de Alexander es la venta de Ropa. el credito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio comprando, Blusas, Camisas, ropa interior para damas y caballeron, ropa escolares, gracias a las ganancias adquiridad a podido mejorar su vivienda y asi le da a sus hijos las condiciones necesarios en el hogar, Agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de Kiva y Afodenic con estos financiamientos que le han otorgado.
texts.en:
Alexander has had his own business for more than five years. Together with his wife he has fought to get ahead. Alexander's business activity is the sale of clothing. The loan he is requesting is for investing in his business, to purchase blouses, shirts, and underwear for women and men, and school clothing. Thanks to his earnings he has been able to improve his house and therefore give his children the necessary conditions at home.

He is grateful for the support he has received from Kiva and AFODENIC with these funds they have given him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 30-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. For the past five years, she has been in the business of selling milk, which comes from her one cow, one buffalo, and four goats. She provides a valuable service in her community by selling milk to many of her neighbors, as well as butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She also purchases goats and sheep and sells them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha. Her sons help her with her business, as does her husband, who is a school teacher. 

Shagufta is in her second loan cycle and she has a strong association with BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more buffalo, to increase the production capacity of her milk business. She wishes to use part of the revenue for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Гузал родилась в 1982 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Гузал планирует открыть свой бизнес. Она хочет открыть продуктовый магазин возле своего дома. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Гузал должна сделать косметический ремонт помещения, а также купить продукты питания как мука, макарон, сахар и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Guzal was born in 1982.  She is married and raising two children.  Guzal plans to open her own business.  She wants to open a food market near her house.  To achieve this goal, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate.  Guzal has make cosmetic repairs of the space and also buy food products, such as flour, pasta, sugar, etc.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to make repairs to her food market and buy food products

loans.name: Oyimkhol

texts.ru: Ойимхол молодая и энергичная женщина. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем и вместе со своей семьей живет на северной части Таджикистана. Ойимхол имеет «золотые руки». Она очень умело шьет национальные женские платья. Ойимхол более 4 года занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Ойимхол имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ойимхол хочет купить мебель для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oyimkhol is a young and energetic woman.  She is 20 years old.  She is not married and lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan.  Oyimkhol has "golden hands."  She masterfully sews women's national dresses.  Oyimkhol has been involved in providing seamstress services for over 4 years.  She provides her services at home.  Oyimkhol has an additional income from animal husbandry.  Oyimkhol wants to purchase furniture for her home, but does not have money.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to purchase furniture.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women’s wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase twenty pieces of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of lesos (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Erabella

texts.en:
Erabella runs a sari-sari (variety store) retail business to earn an income. She sells various household goods and food items to members of her community. She also runs a small farm where she grows rice. She and her husband have five children and live in Corella, Bohol.
 
Erabella is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her farm, as well as canned goods, beverages, soap, and toiletries to sell in her store. With the expected profits generated from this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as her store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm, as well as canned goods, beverages, soap, and toiletries to sell in her store

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
This is Kou from Liberia; she lives in Sanniquellie of Nimba County. The 25 year old single woman is a mother of four children.  She and her fiancée live together and manage their home and business well. This business was established with money from Kou's mother.  Their table business is located in front of their house which is in one of the biggest communities in Sanniquellie. 

She asks for a loan to buy more salt, onions, rice, oil, and pepper for her business. The business is the only source of income. Kou did not go to school but she plans to educate her children.  Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more salt, onions, rice, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Choern is a 48-year-old widowed mother of two children. The main source of family income comes from rice farming and growing sesame. To supplement the family’s income, she also sells grocery items. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years, and is able to earn about KHR 39,000 to support her family. 

Choern has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Choern will use her portion to buy sesame seeds for sesame planting and use a portion for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income, in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for sesame planting and to harvest rice.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu, age 34 and unmarried, sells clothing items to earn an income. She started her business in 2010 because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income with which to support her two children. The family lives in Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown.

Mamusu works at her business seven days per week from 8 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., and says that the major hardship to her business is its inefficient business location.

Mamusu is requesting a loan in order to purchase a variety of plastic slippers and wax cotton to offer for sale. She is confident that the extra income generated from this loan will allow her to ensure the education of her children and to increase her business. 

In the future, Mamusu plans to expand her business to a higher level. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers and wax cotton to offer for sale

loans.name: Damaris Merari

texts.es:
Damaris es una mujer muy trabajadora de 24 años de edad, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida que se dedica a la albañilería y con su hijo de 8 años de edad.


Damaris, actualmente se encuentra trabajando en un supermercado y también se dedica a la venta de ropa, siendo su madre la que le ayuda a vender cuando esta trabajando. Esta actividad la ha heredado de sus madre, ya que tiene una venta de ropa desde hace 10 años y gracias a ella tiene la experiencia en las ventas.


Con el crédito se  le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda invertir en mas productos como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, short y ropa interior, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y así poder darle una mejor educación y alimentación a sus  futuros hijos.


Damaris, quiere tener un negocio de ropa muy fuerte en la zona, ya que la venta es muy buena y desea dejarle una buena enseñanza a su hijo para que sea trabajador.
texts.en: Damaris is a very hard-working woman who is 24 years old.  She lives with her life partner, who is a bricklayer, and with her eight-year-old son.  Damaris works in a supermarket, and also sells clothing.  Her mother helps her with her clothing sales while she is at work.  Damaris learned this activity from her mother, who has been selling clothing for 10 years, and thanks to her she has sales experience.  The loan will help her to invest in more products, such as: blouses, shirts, pants, shorts and underwear.  This will help her to increase her income, and thus to provide a better education and better food to her future children.  Damaris would like to have a strong clothing business in her neighborhood, as sales are good, and she would like to provide a good education to her son so that he will be hard-working.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shorts and underwear.

loans.name: Yhamil

texts.es:
Yhamil  es soltero, no tiene hijos; vive en casa de su su tia (pero no cancela alquiler, aporta para la cancelacion de servicios basicos), la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja en el area de almacenes  de una emprea de trasnporte internacional.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una computadora ya que el esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y la compuatadora le será demucha utilidad.
El sueño de Yhamil es llegar a ser un contador en la empresa donde trabaja.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yhamil is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his aunt’s house (but he does not pay rent, he contributes to the payment for basic services).  The house is located in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto.

He went to school up until high school.  He currently works in the warehouse area of an international transportation company.

He needs the loan to buy a computer.  He is studying accounting, and the computer will be very useful to him.

Yhamil’s dream is to be an accountant at the company where he works.

This is the first time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will be very helpful to him in his accounting studies.

loans.name: Yursin

texts.ru: Юрсин добросердечная женщина. Она трудится упорно для благополучия своей семьи. Юрсин замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она более 8 лет занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает крупно-рогатого скота. Юрсин имеет хорошую возможность развевать свой бизнес, так как она живет в сельской местности. Юрсин должна провести свадебное торжество своего сына, так как он хочет женится на любимой девушке. Юрсин хочет видеть своего сына счастливым. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Yursin is a kind-hearted woman.  She works hard for the welfare of her family.  Yursin is married and raising 3 children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years.  She fattens up cattle.  Yursin has a good opportunity to develop her business because she lives in a rural area.  Yursin has to hold a wedding party for her son becuase he wants to marry his beloved young woman.  Yursin wants to see his son happy.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to hold a wedding party for her son.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахринисо родилась в 1966 году. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Бахринисо вдова и сама обеспечивает своих детей. Она опытная швея. Бахринисо шьёт национальные платья, халаты, брюки и занавески. Бахринисо раньше работала швеёй в швейной фабрике. Теперь она имеет свой бизнес. Бахринисо предоставляет свои услуги дома и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Бахринисо очень общительная женщина. Она имеет уважение среди местного населения. Бахринисо хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Бахринисо запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahriniso was born in 1966.  She is a hardworking woman.  Bahriniso is a widow and provides for her children herself.  She is an experienced seamstress.  Bahriniso sews national dresses, robes, pants and drapes.  Bahriniso previously worked as a seamstress at a sewing factory.  Now she has her own business.  Bahriniso provides her service at home and has her own regular clients.  Bahriniso is very personable woman.  She is respected among the local population.  Bahriniso wants to repair her house because it is in a bad condition.  Bahriniso is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара образованная и грамотная женщина. Она уже 18 лет работает адвокатом, защищает социальные права женщин. Гулсара хочет, чтобы в жизни торжествовала справедливость. Она рано осталась вдовой и сама вырастила свою дочь. Ее дочери 18 лет. Она скоро выходит замуж. Гулсара должна провести свадьбу своей дочери. Она не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить преданное и провести свадебное торжество своей дочери. Гулсара запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulsara is an educated and literate woman.  She has been working as an attorney, defending women's social rights, for 18 years.  Gulsara wants to see justice prevail in life.  She was left a widow early on and raised her daughter by herself.  Her daughter is 18 years old.  She will be getting married soon.  Gulsara has to hold a wedding for her daughter.  She does not have enough money to buy a dowry and hold a wedding party for her daughter.  Gulsara is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to hold a wedding party for her daughter.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Rasmeymath

texts.en:
Rasmeymath is 18 years old and single. He lives with his parents and other siblings in Stung Treng province. Recently, Rasmeymath just passed his high-school exams and got a grade B. He aims to continue his education in the faculty of business management at Build Bright University in Phnom Penh. He is interested in this major because he realizes that it’s suitable for his personality. His education is subsidized by his parents.

Since the first academic year is starting, Rasmeymath must pay to start his class, but he has insufficient money to cover the costs. That’s why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 500 US Dollars to pay his tuition fees. Rasmeymath is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via programs like Kiva that enable poor students to pursue higher education and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: marta de 37 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Doña Marta solicta un credito para comprar maiz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 47 years old and has been selling tortillas from her home for several years.  She works Monday through Sunday and has many customers because she is very hardworking and friendly.  She uses her earnings to help her husband cover the household expenses; she lives with her husband and two children.  Marta is asking for a loan to buy dried corn by the quintal, and lime so she can continue making tortillas.  In this way she can generate more income and have better financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es separada;  tiene tres hijos, dos en etapa escolar y un niño de 3 años que aun no asiste al colegio, viven en casa de sus suegros, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario y se dedica al lavado de ropa para distintas personas, ademas los fines de semana ella lava ropa y frazadas en rios.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una lavadora asi ella podra llevar a su casa la ropa, cuidadando asi su salud.
El sueño de Silvia es tener su casa propia y brindar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Es la segunda   vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Silvia is separated; she has three children, two in school and a 3 year-old boy who is not in school yet. They live in the house of their in-laws; the house is located in the Villa Ingenio zone in the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan to buy a washing machine so she will be able to take the clothing to her house and, therefore, take care of her health. Silvia's dream is to have her own house and give a better quality of life to her children.

This is the second time she has applied for a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help with her clothes washing business.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is a 35-year-old married woman with six children, three children are in school.

Salve is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. Salve requests a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and rice bran for her pigs.

Salve has been raising pigs for 2 years and has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and rice bran for her pigs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has five kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Muthoki

texts.en:
Muthoki is a very hardworking woman who lives in the coastal region.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a water selling business for the last two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase water pipes for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for her business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a single woman with one school-aged child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a business to sell khangas (printed cotton fabric). She faces a major challenge of changing weather conditions in her place of operation. 

The 25,000 KES will allow Annah to purchase more pieces of khangas to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pieces of khangas( printed cotton fabric)  for resale.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Here is 37 year old Helena from Liberia. She lives in Sanniquellie the capital of Nimba County.  

Helena has a 7th grade education.  She is unmarried to a driver and they have three children between the ages of 7 and 17.  The children are in school and live at home.  

Helena received money from her friends to establish a business to sell slippers.   She requests  a loan to buy a variety of slippers to attract more customers to her business.  She sells from 8am to 5pm every day.  She is proud that her business is the major source of her income.  

Her dream is to acquire more customers and educate her children. She gladly thanks Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy more and different types of slipper to attract more customers for her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 62-year-old married Ugandan male. He has seven children aged 24, 22, 20,18,16,14 and 12 and two grandchildren.

He is a farmer who grows coffee and cereal crops such as rice and maize. He has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to plaster and repair his residence. He hopes to repay this loan using proceeds from his farming business and the sale of milk and cassava.

His main challenges are weather conditions and competition from other producers.

He describes himself as hardworking and honest. His dream is to educate all his children and see them have their own families.

loans.use: to complete his residence.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, age 48 and widowed, sells such items as palm oil, salt, and sugar at a market table to earn an income. She started her business 12 years ago with money received from her eldest brother. She works 12 hours a day, Monday through Saturday. She reports that her primary business hardship is her insufficient income.

Esther lives in Sanniquelle, the largest city of Nimba County, which is the second-most populous county in Liberia. It is an area rich in natural resources where living conditions are much better than in the capital city. Esther did not have the opportunity to go to school, and she is the widowed mother of four children, aged between 15 and 29 years old. All her children are still attending school and living at home with her. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items such as palm oil, salt, and sugar to offer for sale. 

Her goal is to one day to build a shop and a house.

loans.use: to purchase items such as palm oil, salt, and sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty, age 36, sells such items as pepper, palm oil, and gari (dried ground cassava) to earn an income. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. six days per week. She reports that the main challenge to her enterprise is that sometimes her vehicle breaks down on the way to her place of business.

Mabinty lives with her husband and their four children in Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

She has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. The extra income generated from this loan will allow her to ensure the education of her children and to repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a larger food store. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to offer for sale

loans.name: Roy Darwin

texts.es:
Roy es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante y superarse; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Roy no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.  
Por iniciativa propia, Roy trabaja como chófer de taxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Roy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamista Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos del mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, de esta manera tendrá en mejores condiciones su herramienta de trabajo,así pues Roy seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Roy is a 21-year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and devotes all his efforts to getting ahead and excelling. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial means and a need to work, Roy was not able to get a professional degree.

By his own initiative, Roy works as a taxi driver, offering transportation services in his city. He works everyday for approximately 10 hours. He believes that it is going well for him because of his dedication and because he knows the areas to find large numbers of passengers.

Roy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their assistance, he will cover the costs of maintenance and repair of his vehicle. This way, his work tool will be in the best condition, and Roy will continue working and striving to achieve his grand dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to improve his vehicle.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen, 28 years old, lives with his parents in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Arsen studies at the Yerevan State University in a distance learning division while also running his own business. He sells different household products (diapers, toilet paper, etc.) both wholesale and retail. Arsen’s father works in the military sphere and his mother is an accountant. Arsen greatly helps his parents financially.

Arsen is asking for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to renew his products and to expand his assortment of products.

loans.use: to renew and expand his product offering

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en: Mchekwisha appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase water pipes for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for her business

loans.name: Jasin

texts.es: Doña Jasin es una mujer con 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y hace cuatro meses se divorció de su esposo, el cual estaba separada desde hace cinco años. Es trabajadora y con deseos de superación tanto a nivel personal como familiar. Se dedica a su negocio desde hace muchos años pero desde que se separó de su esposo se ha dedicado con mayor fuerza a vender más para obtener mayores ingresos, debido a que tuvo que satisfacer todas las necesidades de su hogar y de estudio de sus hijos. Actualmente solo una hija estudia la cual está en secundaria y su hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente a su madre. Ella solicita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio en ésta época que se aproxima. Asi ir mejorando las condiciones de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Doña Jasin is a 42-year old woman who has two children.  She and her husband divorced four months ago, after five years of separation.   Doña Jasin is hard-working and wants to improve her own and her family's situation.  She has run her business for many years, but has put a lot more effort into it since she and her husband separated; she needed to support her household as well as pay for her children's schooling.  At this time, only her daughter is in school, in secondary school, and her son works.  Her son helps her financially.  Doña Jasin is requesting a loan to strengthen her business for the coming season.  In this way, she will be able to improve her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is 25 years old and married. His wife is a housekeeper. Idris grows fruits (apples, pears, cherries, pomegranates, etc.) and vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, eggplants, different kinds of greens) in a handmade greenhouse, which he has been doing for three years. He sells these products at the local bazaar. Idris earns 160 AZN.

Azerbaijani people know that fruits and vegetables are full of various vitamins useful for health. They prepare different healing drinks from fruits and vegetables and make various remedies from therapeutically greens. Vegetables and greens are also used to cook tasty dishes and salads. 

Idris requested a loan from Aqroinvest CU for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to buy more land to grow more fruits and vegetables and earn more income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more land

loans.name: Leonidas Encarnacion

texts.es: El señor Leónidas, es  padre de familia de dos hijos, a quienes brinda ayuda económica y están en edad escolar, el es docente de una universidad, es ingeniero civil y a sus 49 años de edad tiene muchos ánimos de continuar estudiando, solicita el  crédito para pagar una maestría en docencia universitaria de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos económico, que le permita apoyar a su familia mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Leonidas is the father of two elementary school-aged children to whom he provides economic support. He is a teacher at a university and is a Civil Engineer. At 49 years old, Leonidas has a great desire to continue his education. He is requesting the loan to pay for his masters studies in college-level teaching. In this way he will be able to obtain greater earnings, thus allowing him to support his family in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for Masters courses.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de sus cuatro hijos a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Gladys es la venta de comidas regionales por las noches. También prepara almuerzos cuya venta lo realiza por las tardes de lunes a viernes. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y esta actitud sumada a su buena sazón le ha permitido obtener muy buena acogida y demanda. Realiza este negocio desde hace 12 años con la ayuda de su hija. Le gusta su negocio pues comenta que le gusta cocinar, del mismo modo también le agrada el ingreso económico que obtiene por sus ventas los cuales le han permitido pagar sus cuentas y solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Al contrario no le gusta por el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy temprano para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajando con mayor optimismo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para crecer con sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de sus comidas como carnes, plátanos, aceite, condimentos, arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 50-year-old single mother of four children who she loves very much and with whom she lives in her home. Her business is the sale of regional dishes during the evenings. She also prepares lunches that she sells in the afternoons Monday-Friday. She provides friendly service to her customers. This attitude combined with her delicious foods have been well received and demanded among her customers. 

Gladys has run this business for twelve years with the help of her daughter. She likes her business, commenting that she likes to cook and also is pleased with the earnings that she receives from the sales. This has allowed her to pay her bills and cover her household's basic expenses. However, she does not enjoy the physical fatigue that comes along with waking up early to prepare her business for the day. This does not discourage her and she continues working with a high level of optimism. 

At this time Gladys is requesting 1,500 nuevos soles. She feels content with the financial support to expand her business. With the amount requested, she will gradually buy all of the ingredients that she uses to prepare his dishes, including meats, plantains, oil, condiments, and rice.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including meats, plantains, oil, condiments, and rice.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell. She has continued with the same business of retail alongside owning rentals. She is facing challenges of low capital; however, she has a vision of having a wholesale shop. Christine needs a loan to add in stock such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to add in stock  such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lou

texts.en:
Maria Lou is 33 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Maria Lou works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Lou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, snack foods, milk, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Maria Lou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 40-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell in the Christmas season, based on the increased customers during that season.

She still faces the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal customers. She also maintains her personal goals of educating her children and buying a car. Rosette needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell this Christmas season

loans.name: Fomu

texts.en:
Fomu is a married mother of five children, all of whom go to school and work. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Fomu has operated a food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is price fluctuations. Fomu dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

Fomu wants to use her KES 50,000 loan to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia appreciates for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: La Solidarite 3 Group

texts.en: Marcel is the leader of la SOLIDARITE 3 group, which consists of two other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Marcel is married and has three children, all in school. He is in his fourth loan cycle with HOPE Congo. Marcel will use the loan to purchase raw materials such as sugar, oil, salt, soap, beans, rice, biscuits and soap, which he sells at a profit. His goal is to build a house for his family, to take care of his children's studies, to travel and mostly to expand his business and open a large shop.

loans.use: to increase purchases of raw materials for his store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
38 year old Marie lives in Sanniquellie which is the capital city of Nimba County.  

Marie did not have the opportunity to go to school but decided to start a business in order to earn an income. 

Over the past three years, Marie has sold pepper, oil, salt, onion, and rice from a table in the local market. A problem that she has is insufficient capital. Marie is asking for a 20,000 LRD loan to buy more pepper, oil, salt, onion, and rice to increase her sales.  

She established this business with money she got from her mother. She enjoys the profit and popularity she gains from her business.   Marie and her fiancée live together with six children between the ages of 3 and 13.   All three of her children attend school.  She would like to own a shop and see her children complete high school.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, salt, onion, and rice to increase her sales.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County. This area is rich in natural resources and living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia.  

Dorris is 38 years old and did not attend school. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 10.   Her husband  is a farmer and gave her money to start a business selling G.B.  (dough made of cassava) and soup from a cook shop.  She works 9 hours each day from Monday to Saturday.  A problem she has is the small income.  She requests a loan to purchase more cassava, salt, meat, fish, pepper, onion, etc. for her business.

Her plan is to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, salt, meat, fish, pepper, onion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is 25 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in the Ganta area. For the past six months she has been involved in the sales of fashion slippers. She started this business by selling to friends. She faces the challenge of converting Liberian dollars to US dollars.

Felecia requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more fashion slippers in order to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Aminata, from Waterloo2, in the Western Rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. In 2010, Aminata established her slippers-selling business. She began her business, because she wanted to develop herself and her children. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Aminata requires a loan, in order to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines  es separada  tiene dos hijos, viven en casa de su ex pareja, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primaria y se dedica a la eventa de sombreros  de tela  y mimbre para señora y niñas.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una maquina de coser recta  y telas ya que hace un tiermpo atras ella hizo un curso de confeccion de mandiles y polleras, asi que ella quiere empezar a aplicar todo lo aprendido, comenzando a confeccionar mandiles y polleras.
El sueño de Ines es convertirse en una mayorista de mandiles y polleras para señora.
Es la cuarta   vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ines is separated and has two children. They live in her ex-partner's house, which is located in the Villa Bautista Saavedra area of the city of El Alto.

She studied through grade school and makes her living selling cloth and straw hats for women and girls.

She needs the loan to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine and fabric. A little while ago, she took a course on making aprons and traditional Andean skirts, and she wants to begin applying everything she learned, starting to make aprons and skirts.

Ines' dream is to become a wholesaler of women's aprons and traditional skirts. This is the fourth time she is applying for a loan with IMPRO, and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine, so she can begin making women's aprons and traditional Andean skirts.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is 24 years old and married. For the past year, he has grown fruit trees (apple, peach, etc.) and vegetables in a big greenhouse and sells them at the bazaar. Rahim’s wife helps him in this. His monthly income is 95 AZN. This is not enough to cover his life costs and help his parents.

Azeri people like eating tasty fruit cakes (such as apple cake or peach cake) and fruit jam. They prepare various kinds of sweet jam from ancient times by old traditional recipes. These old recipes help jams stay useful, fresh, and tasty for a long time. Azerbaijan people like to eat jam while drinking hot flavored teas.
 
Rahim applied for a 1,100 AZN loan from Aqroinvest Credit Union and this is his first loan. He wants to repair the greenhouse and buy effective fertilizers for his plants. Rahim is a very responsible and reliable person.

loans.use: to repair his greenhouse and buy fertilizers for his plants.

loans.name: Giovannia Maria

texts.es: La señora Giovannia, emprendedora, trabajadora con grandes deseos de superacion, ella se dedica a la venta de manualidades donde elabora Piñatas, Invitaciones, Recordatorios etc. su esposo labora para una empresa privada como Auxiliar Contable, ella solita el credito para relaizar mejoras en su hogar ya que su mayor sueño es terminar su vivienda, comprando materiales como cemento, arena, pintura, ceramica, ademas para este año ella empezara su negocio en un tramo que hast ubicado en el mercadito del municipio donde podra exibir sus creaciones, Agradece el apoyo que se la ha brindado estos ultimos años.
texts.en: Giovannia is entrepreneurial and hard-working with a great desire to move ahead. She sells handcrafts and makes piñatas, invitations, cards, etc. Her husband works for a private business as an assistant accountant. She is asking for the loan in order to make improvements to her home, since her greatest dream is to finish her house, buying materials such as cement, sand, paint, and tile. Also, this year she will start her business in a space located in the municipality's small market, where she will be able to exhibit her creations. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her these last few years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells electronics materials. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronic items and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and construct his residential house. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to transform into a wholesale business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electronic items

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en:
Tosigwegwe, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with four children who are still in school. She has been running different types of businesses. She sells clothing and bites made from baking flour; she also has a motorcycle transport business. Tosigwegwe has been operating these businesses for three years. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Tosigwegwe's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to make bites to meet her customers' demand and to buy clothes and a motorcycle which supports her financially. Being a widow, Tosigwegwe is really happy with the loans which have made her family earn a good living. She has managed to repay all her loans successfully. Tosigwegwe used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to make bites and to buy clothes and spare parts for the motorcycle. She dreams of building her own house.

Tosigwegwe will share this loan with her loan group "MAKONGO KK" which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to make bites and to buy clothes and spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Benedicto

texts.es:
Juan agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él pudo comprar la prensa hidráulica y le ayudo para hacer bien su trabajo, él tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. 

Juan sigue dedicándose a la reparación de carros, él y su hermano tienen un pequeño taller donde reparar diferentes tipos de vehículos y les va muy bien. Él también en sus horas libres se dedica a la vender palos que extrae de los bosques y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos como por ejemplo pistones, empaques, tornillos, aceites y otras cosas más.  

Juan nació en la comunidad de Mashuay y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Mashuay está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú). Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Juan thanks the lenders for the loan and is pleased with the support. He was able to buy a hydraulic press, which helps him do his job well. He is 38 and is in a common-law marriage from which he has four children. He works hard to support his family. 

Juan is still repairing cars. He and his brother have a small shop where they repair different types of vehicles, and business is good. In his free time, he sells wood poles that he takes from the forest. He now needs a loan to buy replacement parts like pistons, gaskets, screws, and oils. 

Juan was born and lives in Mashuay, located in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Peru. Juan belongs to “Miraflores” de la Asociación Arariwa communal bank.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts like pistons, gaskets, screws, and oils.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene dos hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. 

Humberto continúa dedicándose con la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz, habas y cebada,   él continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores. Humberto sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Miraflores” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. 
 
Humberto nació en la comunidad de Callacancha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Callacancha está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Humberto is grateful to investors for the loan, and he is happy for the support. He is 26 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which he has two children. He is a hardworking person who moves his family forward.

Humberto continues to make his living in agriculture. He has various plots where he plants potatoes, corn, broad beans and barley. He also continues to raise small animals.

Humberto continues to belong to the "Miraflores" community bank. This time, he needs the loan to buy seeds and manure.

Humberto was born in the community of Callacancha, and lives in the same community where he was born. (The community of Callacancha is located in the district of Paucartambo in the Paucartambo province within the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Fatou Mane's Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois est créé le 28 Mai 2001. Le groupe est constitué de 6 femmes très dynamique qui rembourse toujours leur crédit sens difficulté. Madame Clémentine qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main elle est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 3 garçons et de 6 filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de jus de citrons, de l'huile de palme et de gouter(accra, pastel etc...). Elle a une expérience avérée car ayant pratiquer cette activité depuis plus de vingt ans.
