Avec ce prêt sollicité elle compte acheter de l'huile de palme et de la matière première pour le gouter. Les bénéfices tirés serviront à la prise en charge totale de ses enfants.
texts.en: This banc villageois has been created on May 28, 2001. The group is composed of six very dynamic women who always repay their loan without issues. Mrs. Clementine, the one on the left raising her hand in the photo, is the group’s representative. She is a widow and the mother of three sons and six daughters. She sells lemon juice, palm oil and after-school snacks (bean fritters, pastries etc). She has plenty of experience with this work as she has been doing it for over 20 years. With this loan she plans to buy palm oil and ingredients for cooking her snacks. Her revenues will help her to fully provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Sadikjon

texts.en:
Sadikjon is a caring father of 4 children. His wife is Farida. They live together in the Northern part of Tajikistan. 

Sadikjon works in a transportation organization. He is a smart man. Sadikjon always tries to educate his children. His son, Shavkat,  entered the Khujand State University this year to become an Economist. He is a freshman. Shavkat studies hard. Sadikjon wants to pay for his son's tuition  but he does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan to pay for his son's tuition. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 67 years old from Olkalou. He is married and they are blessed with eight children aged 32, 29, 27, 25, 23, 21, 19 and 18 years old.

He is a farmer and he has been in farming for thirty years. He earns an income of KES 15,000. He has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer to boost his farming activity.

He anticipates using his profits from the business to pay his loan, educate his children and boost his farming activity. He hopes to buy a plot and build houses for rent to boost his income.

loans.use: To boost his farming activity by buying more farm inputs.

loans.name: Koryun

texts.en:
Koryun lives in the village of Achajur in the Tavush region. He is married and has two sons (school-aged). His mother and his wife work at the school as teachers. Koryun works at the rescue service as a driver and, using his own car, takes private orders for transporting both people and cargo all around his region. Koryun’s car has not been running very well lately and he cannot drive long distances safely. 

Koryun is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to repair his car so he may drive it safely during these winter months.

loans.use: to repair his car in order to drive it safely during these winter months

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a 41-year-old married lady who operates a hardware shop in a market area within the city. She is a second-time client who was operating her business well until she was faced with a challenge of stiff competition from neighboring shops coupled with the high cost of rent. She hopes that when she gets a loan, she will  be able to stock more goods which will attract more customers and increase her sales.She is hard working and hopes to expand her business with more items to adequately meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her hardware store.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 47 years old and she lives in Vanadzor in Lori region. Lilit is married and she is a mother of a son and a daughter. Her daughter now works in Yerevan at the medicine distributing company. Her son is a student at Vanadzor Pedagogical Institute. Lilit works at the Pedagogical Institute and she is a lecturer on economics. She is a very skilled and beloved pedagogue who creates interesting and interactive lessons by organizing different competitions and seminars to include all the students. 
Lilit asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and useful literature connected with her teaching occupation.

loans.use: to buy a computer and useful literature connected with her teaching occupation

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
Dile wants to buy a milk cow and she needs your financial help. 

This will be her first time applying for a loan from VisionFund Albania. Agriculture and livestock is the type of activity that she has been pursuing for 23 years now and, according to her, she will continue on in the same vein.

“While my husband and one of my sons have been emigrating to the neighbor countries, I have been making my own income, as well. And I have done very well, so far,” said Dile.

Dile is 54 and has five children.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with two children. Lourdes is 44 years old and has one child who is still in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lourdes requests a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 2 years. Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita has been in this business for 20 years.

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like bread, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.  In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like bread, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. Neema thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is married and operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She works hard to support her family. 

Helen Grace requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional goods to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purhcase goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 22-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport along with farming in order to boost his income. He started this business with the hope of increasing his income in order to educate his children. He is facing challenges of competition and the bad roads that cause motorcycle breakdowns. His vision is to construct a permanent house. Christopher needs a loan to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 55 years old and lives in the Ganta area. She is married with four children aged 27 to 34 and only two of them live at home. For the past 6 years, she has been involved in the sales of rice and soup from a local restaurant. Mary has requested a loan to purchase more fish, meat, rice, oil, onion, etc. for her business. The problem she has faced is the USD rate is getting higher every day. She started this business by working in a cook shop (local restaurant) owned by her mother and learned this way of trading from her. She likes how she makes new friends and meets people each day. Mary is proud of having money in her home every day. In the future, she wants to open another shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, rice, oil, onion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 31 years old and lives in Ganta. She is married and her husband is a registrar. They have four children with ages ranging from two to seven. Only three are presently attending school. For the past 5 years, she has been running a shop where she sells rice and soup. She makes lots of profit since she is the only one who sells delicious Liberian food in the local market. Janet is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, onion, Maggi cube, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, onion, Maggi cube, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She makes soft drinks and ice cubes using fruits and juice flavors and sells to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 47 years old and lives in Ganta. She is unmarried and has six children, only two of whom are presently in school and live at home. 

For the past five years she has been selling used clothes of three kinds in the local market. She has lots of customers and makes lots of profit since she is the only one who sells used children's clothes, used ladies' blouses, and used men's jeans trousers, especially during the Christmas season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more of the used clothing mentioned above for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret, 53, is married with five children and resides in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. To support the family, she sells vegetables and fish; her husband is a teacher. She has had this business for five years and earns about 96,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saret has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Saret repaid the loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to support her family.  As the group leader, Saret is going to use her portion to buy vegetables and fish for resale. She hopes to increase her income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish to resell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is married with no child for now. In 2010, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to improve her family's welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of plastic slippers and general stock for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers and general stock for resale

loans.name: Bonkie

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Bonkie from Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown. She is single with one three-year-old child. In 2007, Bonkie established her used clothing material business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to support her child. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business.

Bonkie requires a loan in order to purchase more used clothing for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Bonkie plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Isha from Waterloo2 in the western rural area of Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child who is three years old. In 2004, Isha established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to create income for her survival. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Isha requires a loan to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isha plans to expand her fish business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Nancy Yamile

texts.es:
Es una mujer con deseo de superación   profesional que poco a poco  se ha labrado un futuro en el mundo de la estética y de la cosmetología,  en este momento se encuentra capacitándose en campo alto de suba con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado iniciar su educación universitaria con la cual ella sueña al culminar formar el Spa  pudiendo así brindar un futuro de calidad a los hijos y a ella misma.
Para ella es muy importante terminar la universidad ya que por medio de esta ella adquiere  diversos conocimientos y experiencias que le permiten crecer profesional y personalmente. 
Se encuentra interesada en el convenio KIVA ya que este le permitirá tener un ahorro  para solventar los diferentes gastos que obtienen atreves del estudio y la manutención diaria.
texts.en:
Nancy is a woman with a desire to get ahead professionally. Little by little she worked toward a future in the world of beauty salons and cosmetology. At this moment she is being trained at Campo Alto. Rising with great effort and dedication, she has begun her university studies. She dreams that upon finishing she will open a spa to offer herself and her children a better future. 

It is very important for Nancy to finish university because this will allow her to acquire a diverse range of knowledge and experiences which will help her grow professionally and personally. 

She is interested in working with Kiva because this allows her to have savings to cover the various expenses that she takes on through her studies and daily life.

loans.use: to pay enrollment for one semester.

loans.name: Moses Lubega

texts.en:
Lubega is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the region of Hoima in Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Lubega has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells general household property. 

To help expand his business, Lubega has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business and educate his children, and will help Lubega to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. He hopes that in the future he will be able to change to the wholesale business. 

Lubega is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lubega, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business and educate his children

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man who has been running his convenience store for three years. Mohamad is a hard worker with a very good reputation in his region. Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special offer products, especially before the coming Christmas celebrations. At this time, customers increase their requests for several items, and he has to make sure that he can afford them.

Mohamad is working hard to develop his business and to start selling dairy products. He hopes that one day he might turn his small store into a supermarket.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special offer products, especially before the coming Christmas celebrations

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kijura. She is married and has 3 children, none of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Violet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, posho (maize flour), beans, groundnuts, cooking oil, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Violet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar, posho, beans, groundnuts, cooking oil, soap and salt, and will help Violet to generate greater profits and increase the family income. Violet hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Violet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Violet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, posho, beans, groundnuts, cooking oil, soap and salt

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the  region of Hoima in Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her produce business, which deals in produce. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seeds for produce and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and expand on the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her income. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Harriet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for produce

loans.name: Garatel

texts.en:
Garatel is a 52-year-old woman on a pension. She is married and has a son and a daughter.  Her main source of income is agriculture (gardening). Garatel grows fruit trees (pear, peach, apple, pomegranate, cherry and so on) and sells the fruit at the local bazaar. She has skills from 30 years in gardening and gets 150 AZN for work.
 
In Azerbaijan, the people's demand for fruit is very high. Throughout the whole year, they buy fruits for everyday use. They eat fruits fresh or prepare different tasty and sweet things.

This is the first loan borrowed by Garatel and it is for 1300AZN. Unfortunately, Garatel’s income from gardening and her pension isn’t enough to cover life's demands. That’s why she needs more money. Garatel plans to use her profits to provide for her children’s education and improve the family maintenance.

loans.use: to buy more fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 29-year-old single man who has been working in the cake business for thirteen years. His shop is well known in his region for the special tastes he provides to his customers and for his special competitive prices.

Salam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special raw materials. He will need a lot in order to prepare for the Christmas and New Year's celebrations. Salam is working hard to open another branch and to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special raw materials to be prepared for the Christmas and New Year's celebrations

loans.name: Merida

texts.es: Merida vive con su esposo en casa propia, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de pollo, su negocio lo tienen ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por su amabilidad, la calidad con que los prepara y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Merida esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como pollos, verdura, maíz, tomates, hojas de huerta para envolverlos, etc. y continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y tener un mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Merida lives with her husband in a home of her own and has been making and selling chicken tamales for three years.  Her business is located within her home and she has many customers because of her friendliness and good prices.  She uses her income to help her husband with the household expenses.  Merida is asking for a loan to buy the necessary ingredients such as chicken, vegetables, corn, tomatoes, leaves to wrap them in, etc. and continue with the work that generates a good income for her and allows a better quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él compro oro y le fue muy bien con el crédito, él tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. 

Marcelino continua dedicándose a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz, habas y cebada, él continúa dedicándose a la venta de oro y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar oro.

 Marcelino nació en la comunidad de Callacancha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Callacancha está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú). Marcelino pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores”.
texts.en:
Marcelino is grateful to Kiva lenders for this loan and is happy for the help being offered him.  With his most recent loan, he bought some gold and the loan worked very well for him.  He is 34 years old and is in a free union with his wife, with whom he has 4 children.  He is hardworking and strives to help his family progress.

Marcelino continues to work in farming, since he has several plots of land where he grows potatoes, corn, beans, and barley.  He also continues to work selling gold and at this time is asking for a loan so as to buy gold to sell.

Marcelino was born in the city of Callacancha and lives in the same city where he was born.  Callacancha is located in the Paucartambo district, within the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department of Peru.  Marcelino is a member of the "Miraflores" communal bank.

loans.use: buy gold to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Haydee

texts.es: Francisca de 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas,  entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela porque sus productos son buenos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, lociones, etc. con la ayuda solicitada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Francisca, 38, sells personal care products like lotions, deodorants, perfumes, and creams. Her business is in her house. She has lots of customers because her merchandise is good. She is able to pay household expenses with the profit from her sales and with her husband's help. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children.

Francisca wants to grow her business and has applied for a loan to buy needed inventory like perfume, nail polish, deodorants, creams, shampoo, and lotions. With the loan, she will be able to earn more and give her family everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy perfume, nail polish, deodorants, creams, shampoo, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Geysel Baruc

texts.es: Geysel  de 30 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposo quien es empleado de una funeraria , desde hace varios años se dedica  a la confeccion de prendas de vestir su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y  los buenos precios,  Geysel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de tela, hilos, botones, agujas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos  y asi ella y su esposo puedan tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Geysel, 30, lives in a rented house with her husband, who works at a funeral home. For some years, she has been sewing garments. Her business is located in her house, and she has many clients because she is friendly and offers great prices. Geysel has applied for a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, and more to keep working, since this is her only income source and the means by which she and her husband can achieve greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Triunfadoras De Cañadas Group

texts.es: Dúo Triunfadoras de Cañadas Doña Nohelia de 44 años de edad, quien es originaria del departamento de Jutiapa y comerciante desde ya más de 6 años en el municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez,  con la  elaboración y venta de pasteles, doña Noelia  vende semanalmente 14 pasteles, entre entregas a sus clientes y vende de manera ambulante, ahora doña Nohelia ve la necesidad en comprar una batidora  especialmente para pastelería, con esto ella ahorraría mucho tiempo y la calidad del pan es mucho mejor, es por ello que solicita de  capital para adquirir cuanto antes este aparato básico en su negocio,  ya que en estas fechas la demanda de los pasteles aumenta para doña Nohelia.
texts.en:
Dúo Triunfadoras de Cañadas

Nohelia, age 44, is from the Jutiapa department.  She has been a merchant in the San Juan Sacatepéquez municipality for over six years.  She makes and sells cakes.  Noelia sells 14 cakes a week.  She makes deliveries to her customers, and she sells in an itinerant manner.

Nohelia now needs to buy a mixer specifically for pastries.  With this she will save a lot of time, and the quality is much better.  That is why she is requesting money to get this basic apparatus as soon as possible for her business.  During this time of year the demand for pastries increases for Nohelia.

loans.use: to buy a mixer for making cakes.

loans.name: Luisa Carolina

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Estrella Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de 3 años de edad. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña Luisa para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder solventar algunos  gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Ella sale a vender en los ratos que está desocupada, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños y así aprovechar la época de Navidad y fin de Año que es cuando más se vende. Lleva  6 ciclos y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The credit group Estrella Del Mar (Star of the Sea) meets every 15 days in the lovely neighborhood of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by domestic and international tourists. Most of the inhabitants in this area are fishermen and take other sea-related jobs. 
This is where Luisa lives. She is 19 years old and maintains a relationship that has produced one girl who is 3 years old. Her husband is a fisherman. 
Luisa, in order to earn enough on her own, and with this be able to take care of some of the household costs. She sells all kinds of clothing for a living. She sells door to door and she also sells items from her home where her clients arrive to purchase her products. She leaves to sell her products when she has free time and she offers payment plans to her customers. She purchases her merchandise in Manta. She has been doing this for 3 years and everything is going well. 
This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise like: pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing and she wants to take advantage of the Holiday season to sell more. She has had 6 loans and she likes participating in the program because she was able to start her business with her first loan. Her dream is to offer the best products at her store to her customers.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас вместе со своими родителями и сестрами живет на Северной части Таджикистана. Она не имела возможности поступить в университет после окончания средней школы. Мукаддас уже более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она занимается скотоводством. Мукаддас сама выращивает сено для скота. Мукаддас откармливает скот дома несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Мукаддас использует полученный доход от бизнеса для обеспечения семьи. Скоро ее старшая сестра выходит замуж, но ее родители не имеют денег для проведения свадебного торжества ее сестры. Мукаддас хочет помочь своей сестре. Она хочет увидеть свою сестру счастливой. Мукаддас запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей сестры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukaddas lives with her parents and sisters in northern Tajikistan. She is single and was not able to go to university after finishing high school. She has already had her own business for more than five years raising livestock and growing hay for her cattle. She feeds the livestock for a few months and then sells them on the local market. Mukaddas uses the profits from her business to help support her family. 

Her older sister is getting married soon, but their parents do not have the money to pay for a wedding reception. Mukaddas wants to help her sister and see her happy. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to pay for her sister's wedding reception. Mukaddas awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her sister's wedding.

loans.name: Mame Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 32 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2013. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité et les environs. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaire. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Mame, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle s'investit dans le commerce de bois et de charbon. Elle achète 01 pile de bois à 55 000 F et 05 sacs de charbon à 6 000 F. Elle réalise un bénéfice de 500 F par sac de charbon et 7500 F pour le bois.
Les bénéfices vont servir à prendre en charge ses enfants à savoir tout leur besoin vue qu'elle est seule soutien de famille car ne souhaitant pas solliciter tout le temps l'aide d'autrui.
texts.en:
This group of 32 members is a part of the "banc villageois" which was created October 22, 2013. It is made up of members who live in the same area and surroundings. They all live well and support each other. Their main activity is small business.

Mame, featured standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 51 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children, one of whom is a son. She is in the business of selling wood and charcoal. She purchases one pile of wood at 55,000 francs CFA and 5 bags of charcoal at 6,000 francs CFA. She earns a profit of 500 francs CFA per bag of charcoal and 7,500 francs CFA for the wood.

The profits will help Mame to provide for her children and all of there needs, since she is the sole supporter of the family and does not want to constantly be requesting support from others.

loans.use: to purchase wood and charcoal

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. Josphine has operated a cereals shop at the market for the past two years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, groundnuts and lentils. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of grains and other foods to sell, including maize, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
Yei is 39 years old and lives in Ganta. She attended school through sixth grade, is single, and has five children.  Only four are attending school and they all live at home. 

Over the past 20 years she has been selling fufu (crushed cassava) from a table.  She learned this way of selling from her mother. She uses a motorbike most of the time to get her fufu from the village.  She boosts how she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fufu for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fufu for her business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Roger Andrés

texts.es:
Roger trabajó durante varios años como empleado en una discoteca, en la que obtuvo experiencia en servicio al cliente pero, ya cansado de trasnochar y de no compartir tiempo con su familia tomó la decisión de retirarse e independizarse, aprovechando que una amiga puso en venta un negocio de comidas rápidas y, con unos ahorros que tenía lo compró con el ánimo de percibir mejores ingresos para sustentar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y su hijo de 1 año. 
Con el firme propósito de fortalecer su negocio y posicionarlo en el sector, solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar adecuaciones locativas, mejorar el carro de comidas, comprar silletería, mesas e insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, gaseosas, salsas, desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del establecimiento y cambiar la percepción de las personas que transitan el sector, además podrá ofrecer un servicio más ágil y sus clientes disfrutarán los productos más cómodos.
Es así como Roger desea seguir luchando para cumplir sus proyectos, especialmente desea adquirir un local más amplio, en el que pueda atender mayor cantidad de clientela y así mejorar sustancialmente sus ventas e ingresos para ofrecer a su familia un mejor bienestar y un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Roger worked for several years as an employee at a club, where he gained experience in customer service, but he grew tired of staying up late and he was unable to spend time with his family. And so he made the decision to quit his job and form his own business, taking advantage of the fact that one of his friends was selling her restaurant and with some of his savings, he purchased it and when he saw himself making more money he became even more enthusiastic, knowing that he would be able to provide basic necessities for his wife and one year old child.
 
With the firm resolution to strengthen his business and to make a name for himself, he is asking for a loan in order to do some remodeling, to improve his food cart, purchase seating, tables and supplies on wholesale (breads, cold cut meats, sodas, sauces, disposables, among others), this will allow him to improve the image of his establishment and to change the perception people have of it who pass by, as well as being able to offer a more efficient service and his customers will enjoy his products more comfortably. 

And this is how Roger will continue fighting to see his projects through, especially his desire to buy a larger space, where he can serve a larger number of customers and will be able to substantially improve his sales and his income so he can offer his family a better life and a more prosperous future.

loans.use: To make changes to his restaurant, improve his food cart, purchase seating, tables and purchase supplies on wholesale.

loans.name: Ajina

texts.en:
Ajina is a 29-year-old woman from Maynaguri who lives with her husband, Nur, and their three children in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw). Their children are receiving a higher education though she and her husband are illiterate and are only able to sign their names. Ajina works in an iron foundry under a blacksmith while her husband is engaged in his own business. 

Ajina is an expert in making various things from iron but now she is losing her tenacity due to her low income. Their family expenditures are going beyond their wages. Therefore, Ajina is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to start her own blacksmith business to make different household equipment for daily use like scissors, knives, nails, iron strings etc to sell at the market. As there is a great demand for these products in her locality, she will earn much profit from this business. This profit will enable her to lead a smooth life and give her children a good education undoubtedly to establish them. She will be grateful to Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase irons and other blacksmith materials

loans.name: Debasree

texts.en:
Debasree, a 54 year-old woman from Khagrabari village in Maynaguri, is blessed with two sons. She and her husband Paresh are illiterate but can sign their names. They have their own wood business. Their son is also engaged in the same business. 

Debasree needs a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more varieties of wood to sell to different furniture shops and in the wholesale market. She also wants to supply wood, timbers, plywood etc to the factories making furniture to earn a great profit from her business. This will enable her to run her family with a high income and increase her business strength in the future. 

Her dedication and tenacity help her to enrich her family with the profit from her business. Debasree would have to fight her battle alone if BJS and Kiva did not come her way and stand beside her, so she is thanking them sincerely.

loans.use: To purchase various types of wood

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom, age 48, is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Kalsoom, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan amount. Kalsoom is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Gbassy

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Gbassy from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2010, Gbassy established her food container business. She began her business because she wants to contribute to taking care of the home. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem within her operation area.

Gbassy requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Gbassy plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She also supports two relatives at home. 

Fatmata runs a general food container business within her community, where she sells cups, plates, and food containers; she has been in this business since 2010. Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cups, plates, and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates, and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Sulma Yojana

texts.es:
Sulma a sus 22 años de edad es una joven dinamia, activa, emprendedora, soltera y sin hijos con un grado de estudio de secundaria completa graduándose como enfermera gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres tanto financiero como moral. Por la falta de empleo en su comunidad ella no ejerce su profesión y decidió adaptarse a la agricultura y comercio ya que sus padres tienen cultivo de café y también cultivan hortaliza como Chile dulce y tomate que por más de varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad también aprendió a comercializarlo. Sus clientes son las bodegas de la comunidad, las tiendas de verduras en la zona entre otros como los intermediarios y demás. La tierra que en compañía de su familia trabaja es propia la cual está ubicada muy cerca de su casa de habitación a la cual se dirigen caminando.
Los planes a futuro lograr tecnificar sus cultivos de café mejorando de esa manera la calidad y volumen de producción del mismo como también para sus cultivos de hortalizas. También ella desea mejorar la casa de habitación de sus padres a quienes ella apoya y ama mucho por todo el apoyo brindado hasta hoy en día. 
El financiamiento que ella hoy en día solicita a la cooperativa COMIXMUL será invertido en la asistencia de una pequeña parcela de Chile y tomate que recientemente trabajaron con el cual planean tener una excelente cosecha para poder cumplir con su compromiso y seguir gozando de los beneficios que la cooperativa COMIXMUL ofrece.
texts.en:
Sulma is 22 years old and is a dynamic, active, and ambitious young woman.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  She completed secondary school and graduated as a nurse thanks to her parents' financial and moral support.  Due to a lack of jobs in her community, she doesn't practice her profession and decided to switch to farming and business.  Her parents have a farm where they grow coffee and vegetables such as sweet peppers and tomatoes.  They have had the farm for many years and have learned to sell their crops as well.  Their customers include various grocery stores, vegetable vendors, and others.  The land that she and her family work is owned by them and is located very close to their house (they are able to walk there).

Her future plans include modernizing her coffee and vegetable production, thereby improving the quality and amount of her harvest.  In addition, she wants to improve her parents' house, since they have helped her so much and she supports and loves them.

The loan that she is asking for with COMIXMUL will be used to help cultivate a small plot of chiles and tomatoes on land which they recently prepared for planting.  They are hoping to have a good harvest from it so as to be able to pay their debt and continue enjoying the benefits that COMIXMUL offers them.

loans.use: buy farming supplies for her sweet peppers and tomatoes.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 26 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past five years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes of different types. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and take care of herself by buying new clothes. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in her clothing shop.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region in Uganda. She is married and has four children two of which are currently in school. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells beans, peas, tomatoes, sugar, posho, cooking oil, salt, soap and other items. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stocks of beans, peas, tomatoes, sugar, posho, cooking oil, salt, soap and other items and will help Christine to generate greater profits and take care of her children. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beans, peas, tomatoes, sugar, posho, cooking oil, salt, soap and other items for her store.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos  en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, 42, lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. For 25 years, he has been farming. His main crops are corn and beans, which he sells in local markets. He is able to pay some of the household expenses after selling his crops. José has applied for a loan to buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, and other supplies for his land, which is shown in the photo, so that he can keep planting and earn more to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, and pesticide for his land.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: Lilian de 39 años de edad posee desde hace 4 años un chalet ubicado dentro de la unidad de salud que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, vende todo tipo de golosinas y refrescos, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que ofrece y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos quienes estudian actualmente, Lilian esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos para surtir aun mas su chalet con: galletas, dulces, churros, jugos, agua, gaseosa, etc. y seguir con su trabajo para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia un mejor estabilidad eonomica.
texts.en:
Lilian, age 39, has had a store inside the health facility for four years.  It is close to where she lives.  She sells all types of sweets and soft drinks.  She has a lot of customers because of the variety of products that she sells and the good prices.

She lives in her own house with her husband and their four children.  The children currently go to school.

Lilian is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock her store even more with cookies, sweets, churros, juices, water, and soft drinks, etc.  She will continue with her work in order to get better income and to give her family better financial security.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sweets, churros, juices, water, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 35 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en las diferentes agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos tiene clientela fija ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios muy comodos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Luis esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc.  para poder seguir con sus siembras y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Luis, 35, has been farming and planting corn and beans for several years. He sells the harvest to basic grain middlemen. He has loyal customers because he offers good-quality merchandise at affordable prices. He is able to pay some household expenses on selling his crops. Luis has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, seed, and more to keep planting so that he and his wife enjoy a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, seed, etc.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 66 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven,Martha no pudo culminar su carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Martha trabaja en su pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana, puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su trato amable y dedicación.
Martha se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería como gaseosas, refrescos, golosinas, abarrotes y otros, de esta manera Martha tendrá abastecida su bodega y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues Martha seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de mantener a su familia unidad.
texts.en:
Martha is a 66 year old woman who lives in the city of Chiclayo (in the Guadalupe district) with her husband and their 5 children.  She is very hardworking and enthusiastic.  Together with her husband, they put everything they have into helping their family progress.  Unfortunately, due to financial difficulties and having to work starting at a young age, she wasn't able to study a professional career.

Through her own efforts, Martha works in a small grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks.  She works every day starting very early in the morning and then for 10 hours a day.  She believes that it is going well for her due to her customer service and dedication.

Martha is very grateful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a larger amount and variety of merchandise, including soda water, soft drinks, candy, groceries, and other things.  In this way, Martha will be able to stock her store and be able to assist more customers.  She will continue working and striving to accomplish her goal of keeping her family together.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora dinámica, además de ser alegre y amable. Es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 20 y 18 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de sus hijos en un cuarto alquilado. El trabajo de Maritza consiste en la venta de ropa, trabaja vendiendo entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, empezó desde hace 02 años y hasta el momento le va muy bien. Trabaja cómodamente sin descuidar las labores de su hogar. En esta temporada está ofreciendo vestidos, polos, blusas, jeans, faldas y otros artículos preferentemente para el público femenino ya que se acerca las fiestas navideñas. Anteriormente vendía jugos y desayunos en la vereda de su casa. Se siente muy a gusto desarrollando su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo es retribuido en los buenos ingresos que tiene, pero ella necesita de alguna ayuda adicional ya que se quiere preparar para la campaña navideña próxima incrementando la cantidad de su mercadería, por fortuna le está yendo bien ya que vende mucho pero a falta de inversión es que no aumentan sus ventas considerablemente, su principal objetico es hacer que su negocio crezca y sea prospero. En esta oportunidad solicitara s/. 2500; por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para realizar su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería entre vestidos, polos, pantalones y algunos otros productos que solicita su distinguida clientela.
texts.en: Forty-three-year-old Maritza is a dynamic, hard-working, happy and friendly woman. She is a single mother to three children, aged 24, 20 and 18 years old respectively. Martiza lives in a rented room with her children. She works selling clothes to friends, neighbours and family members. She started doing this two years ago and, so far, it is going very well. Maritza has time for her work without neglecting the household chores. Maritza is selling dresses, t-shirts, blouses, jeans, skirts and other clothing items during this season. She is selling mainly women's clothes just now as the Christmas season is approaching. Maritza previously sold juices in a villages outside her home.  Maritza feels very happy with her work as her effort is reflected in the good income she makes. Nevertheless she still needs additional help as she wants to be prepared for Christmas and increase the quantity of merchandise she has.  Fortunately Maritza's business is going well as she is selling a lot, but without investment, her sales will not increase significantly. Maritza's main objective is to expand her business and to be prosperous. On this occasion Maritza is applying for a loan of 2500 Nuevo Soles. She thanks everyone who is making this loan possible for helping her to do her job better. Maritza also promises, once again, to be punctual with her repayments. Maritza will use this loan to buy larger quantities of merchandise, including dresses, t-shirts, trousers and other items which her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as skirts, t-shirts, trousers and more.

loans.name: Imomuddin

texts.ru: Имомуддин родился в 1971 году. Он вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Имомуддин занимается скотоводством. Он начал бизнес скотоводством 3 года назад, так как он нуждался в деньгах. Он воспитывает 3 детей. Его жена швея. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Имомуддин  является повторным клиентом ИМОНа. Он имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Имомуддин обратился за займом для того, чтобы провести свадебное торжество своей дочери. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Imomuddin was born in 1971. He lives with his family in a remote region. Imomuddin raises livestock and started his business three years ago because he needed money. 

Imomuddin is raising three children. His wife is a seamstress and offers her services at home. Imomuddin is a returning client to IMON. He has a good credit history. He is asking for a loan of US$1,500 for his daughter's wedding. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Hasanboy

texts.ru: Хасанбой родился в 1980 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Хасанбой всегда старается для благо получения своей семьи. Он живет в отдаленном регионе. Хасанбой уже более 9 лет занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Хасанбой является основным кормильцем семьи. Его жена швея и имеет маленький доход. Хасанбой должен провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для проведения церемония обрезания своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hasanboy was born in 1980. He is married with five children and always strives for the benefit of his family. He lives in a remote region, and for more than nine years has raised livestock. He buys the cattle, fattens them for a few months and sells them in the local market. 

Hasanboy is his family's main breadwinner. His wife is a seamstress and earns a small salary. He needs to have a circumcision ceremony for his son, but doesn't have the money. Hasanboy is asking for a loan in the amount of US$1,500. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his son's circumcision ceremony.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en: Muhammadjon was born in 1967 year. He is an entrepreneur. Muhammadjon is married and has two children. Gulbahor is his wife and Marufjon and Shohista are his children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. Muhammadjon feeds big cattle. He earns additional income from growing cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. Muhammadjon’s wife and son help him manage the business. He is going to repair his house as his house is in a bad condition. He is asking for a loan 2,000 Somoni to buy building materials to repair the house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Winfrida , who is in her mid-30's, is married with two children who are still at school. She has been running several types of businesses: selling cement, a beauty salon, and selling charcoal. She has been in her business for four years now.

This will be Winfrida's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start her cement business. She bought more sacks of charcoal and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, bought a TV set, sofa set, radio, built her house, and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy bags of cement, salon equipment, and sacks of charcoal. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.

Winfrida will share this loan with her loan group "Muheza" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement,  salon equipment, and sacks of  charcoal.

loans.name: Magaly Aracely

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Magaly, tiene  53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, 4 mayores  de edad y otro de 15 años el cual estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Magaly  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos   como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además también vende ciertas medicinas y artículos de bazar,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan cuando están desocupados, su negocio empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco hace como 15 años por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución ya que  así ella se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y productos de bazar. Es fundadora del  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos siempre mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The "San José" loan group meets every fortnight in the Jaramijo canton, a place known for its beautiful beaches that run along the coast.  Here the majority of people are very hard-working and work in sea-related jobs.

And it is here that 53-year-old Magaly lives. She is married and has five children, four of whom are now adults while the youngest is 15 years old and in school. The youngest still lives at home; Magaly's husband is a fisherman.

Magaly has a grocery store in her house. There she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other items. She also sells some medicines and other items. Magaly works every day from 6am until 8pm, and sometimes until later. Her son and husband help out when they are free. Magaly started her business with a loan 15 years ago and she is very grateful to Fundación ESPOIR for this as it allows her to earn money to support her family.

This loan will be used to further stock up the shop: Magaly will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other items. Magaly is one of the founding members of this loan group and she likes it as the loans always help her to improve her business. Magaly's goals are to move forward with her business and for her business to expand every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other items

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 31 years old and married. She has two children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years, and she earns additional income by selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell in her general store. Marissa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Marissa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 25-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport along with a retail shop that he runs in order to boost his income. He is facing challenges of limited capital and high license fees for the motorcycles. His dream is completing his residential house. Charles needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
This is Fatuma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to repair her water tank, thus reducing any more losses.  

She would like to apply for a loan of KSHS 80,000 to buy water pipes and a new water tank for her business.

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and a new water tank

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is a 64-year-old experienced farmer from the Chkhorotsku district. He lives with his wife, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. 

The family's primary source of income is Boris's work selling agricultural products at the local market, taking care of cattle, and using their products for trading and for personal use. Boris's wife also helps him in this activity. As it becomes harder to earn a living with only this income, Boris decided to start himself another activity. 

With the loan of $2,500, he will purchase a second-hand car and start bread distribution. He will serve local stores and provide them with bread. Boris applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. The new initiative will give Boris a chance to have financial stability and increased monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start bread distribution

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a repeat customer, used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle, to ease the transportation of his agricultural products to the town center after harvest, and also of his retail stock from the town to the village in which he operates his shop. He operates a retail shop, but also does brick-laying and grows coffee and maize, in a rural area in Kagadi -Kibaale district.

John has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX.  He will use this loan to buy more stock for the retail shop, because his dream is to grow it into a big, retail-and-wholesale shop. His main business challenges include heavy rains, which affect his brick-making business and coffee. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 31 years old and lives in Ganta, with her husband and three children. She has been operating a sales table at the local market, where she sells rice, pepper, oil, and similar items. She started this business with help from her father.  Some problems she faces are the prices of goods, and the cost of transportation being too high. She likes the way her business keeps her busy, and the profit she makes every day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and the like, for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and similar items, for her business,

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Western rural region in Freetown, Sierra Leone. A married mother of four, in 2007 Kadiatu established her retail business where works from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that her main challenges are price inflation and the lack of a proper business location.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase cups, flasks and bowls to expand her enterprise. She hopes that the extra income resulting from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cups, flasks and bowls to expand her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Mariama, from Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with five children. She also supports two relatives at home. 

Mariama runs a general merchandise shop in Waterloo2, where she sells items such as drinks and bundles of water. She has been in this business for three years. Mariama says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more drinks and water bundles for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. 

In the future, Mariama would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and water bundles for resale.

loans.name: Amalio

texts.es:
Amalio es un microempresario cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Amalio tiene 55 años, es casado (en la foto aparece con su esposa) y tiene 5 hijos; los cuales son todos casados y no dependen ya de él. Él vive en casa propia y tiene una cocina económica que atiende junto con su esposa. 

En su negocio ofrecen a sus clientes comida y antojitos mexicanos, los cuales los preparan entre él, su esposa y una empleada que tienen. Solicita este crédito para hacer unas mejoras necesarias para su vivienda, como lo es impermeabilizar el techo de su hogar. 

El negocio de Amalio les ha permitido vivir bien a él y su esposa, y sacar adelante a sus hijos; por esto lo procura y lo cuida tanto. Su reto es abrir otra cocina económica en la misma colonia.
texts.en:
Amalio is a microbusiness owner and client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Amalio is 55 years old. He is married (he appears with his wife in the photo) and has 5 children, who are all married and are no longer dependent on him. He lives in his own house and has a home-style restaurant that he runs with his wife.

In his business, he offers his customers Mexican food and snacks that he, his wife, and their employee make. He is asking for this loan in order to make some necessary improvements to his house, such as waterproofing the roof of his home.

Amalio's business has allowed him and his wife to live well and move their children forward; this is why he works so hard and takes such care of it. His goal is to open another home-style restaurant in the same colonia.

loans.use: to waterproof his house and make other improvements to it

loans.name: Amirkhan

texts.en:
Amirkhan, 36, is married and has a son and daughter. For the past ten years he has bred and raised cattle, selling their meat and milk at the local bazaar. Amirkhan's wife keeps house and helps him to look after the animals. His work earns him 200 AZN a month.

Fresh and organic meat, milk and dairy products are very popular among Azerbaijani people, and they use it almost every day. They like to prepare and eat different tasty sweets, using milk to make them. People also use meat almost every day in dishes such as dolma, qutab, lule-kebab and dushbere. Therefore, Amirkhan’s work is steady and profitable.

Amirkhan is applying for a 2000 AZN loan through Aqroinvest to expand and develop his farm. He wants to buy additional cows and other livestock. He is planning to produce more milk to cover customers’ needs and his family's expenses. Amirkhan is a responsible and reliable man and this is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy additional cows and other livestock

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane est chauffeur de profession, il possède un véhicule de marque 305 qu’il veut retaper.
Ousmane a obtenu le permis en 2004 et pendant 5 ans, il conduisait des véhicules qui ne lui appartenaient pas. C’est en 2009 qu’il a eu son premier véhicule qu’il a mis en circulation comme taxi-clando, qu’il conduit lui-même et travaille de 6h à 20heures.
Avec le crédit, il veut réparer son véhicule et changer quelques organes pour pallier aux pannes fréquentes qui l’empêchent de travailler normalement.
Ousmane est marié et grâce aux recettes de l’activité, nourrit sa famille et ses enfants et améliore leurs conditions de vie.
Ousmane veut acquérir un autre véhicule pour maximiser ses revenus.
texts.en: Ousmane is a driver by trade. He has a car of the [Peugeot] 305 brand that he wants to refurbish. He has obtained his driver’s license in 2004. For five years, he has been driving cars belonging to someone else. It is only in 2009 that he obtained his first car and started using it as an unregistered taxi. He drives it himself from 6 AM to 8 PM. With this loan, he will repair his car and replace some parts in order to prevent breakdowns which hinder his work. Ousmane is married and supports his family and his children thanks to income from this work, trying to improve their life conditions. He would like to buy another car to increase his revenues.

loans.use: to have his taxi repaired.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in the town of Kinubi in the hoima region of Uganda. For the past two years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general household items. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more household materials. This loan will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her residential house. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase household materials

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Elwanda Group is a group of six group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Robert selected as the Kiva representative. Robert has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and he is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 55 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).
							
Robert is a reliable member of the community. Robert joined One Acre Fund because he needs better harvests. He is married, with seven children.  Robert is 38 years old and he has been working as a farmer for the last 12 years to support his family. In addition to this, Robert is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group. He described his harvest last year as being good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Robert joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Robert joined One Acre Fund, so that he could get the best seed prices and get new farming methods. Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers. Robert has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund, as a group leader and as a Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Robert's life because he has more farm training and he was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Robert hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and to buy a cow.  							

Robert and the Elwanda Group Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the harvesting of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Wakhungu's Group

texts.en:
Wakhungu is a member of Jikaze Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 77 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Wakhungu also joined One Acre Fund because he needs better harvest. Wakhungu has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
						
Wakhungu is 44 years old and has been a farmer for 17 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his five children. Wakhungu’s life has also improved because he has been a farmer with One Acre Fund. The community and other farmers know Wakhungu as a friendly and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group and savings group. Wakhungu described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but he hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Wakhungu joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Wakhungu joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods, earn enough to feed his family, and send his children to school. Because he wants to help more farmers, Wakhungu has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Wakhungu explains that for the few days he has been with One Acre Fund he feels that his life is improving. In the future, he hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school, repair the home, buy a cow, and invest in a business.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Wakhungu and the Jikaze Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

Please note that there is one additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to have the opportunity to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 23 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the region of Hoima in Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, maize, sweets, bread, omo, and other items. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, maize, sweets, bread, omo, and other items to help generate greater profits and increase stock. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase goods such as fruits from the village to supplement her retail shop.
