Oliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Oliver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize, sweets, bread, omo, and other items to sell her in retail shop.

loans.name: Louis Edward

texts.en:
Louis Edward is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Louis Edward has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home items. 

To help expand his business, Louis Edward has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more home items and will help Louis Edward to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Louis Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to progress in the business world. 

Louis Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Louis Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more home items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Avtandili

texts.en:
Avtandili is a 63-year-old man, who lives in the village of Gelati, in the Tkibuli district. He lives with his mother, son, daughter-in-law, and little grandson. 

The family runs agricultural activities. They have two cattle, cultivate a plot of land, and grow nuts and grapes. The five-member family can't live on this income, so Avtandili decided to start his own private activity. 

Avtandili couldn't request a loan from financial institutions until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. He requested a loan of GEL 500 to begin trading with clothing. He plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell them among his friends and villagers. 

With the increased income, Avtandili will provide a better future for his family. Avtandili awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is 23 years old. He lives with his family, which consists of his wife, two children, and his parents. Rahim is a youth who is hardworking and responsible. From a young age his father taught him to work the land, and this now allows him to contribute to the household finances. He has been engaged in agriculture for four years.

His biggest desire is to repair the house, as with time the roof has deteriorated. He wants to improve it to be safer. This is the reason Rahim is requesting a loan. 

He has a goal: it is to build his own house and live there with his family. This plan stimulates him to expand his agriculture business.

loans.use: To make repairs at his parents' house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a widow and a mother of six children. They live in a three-bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, the economic capital of the Northwestern region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including the loss of her husband, maltreatment of her children by relatives, and inadequate capital to finance a business of her own.

With this new loan, Beatrice will buy oil, flour, and sugar for her fish-roll business and fertilizer and farm seedlings for cultivation. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for long time and knows when and where to cultivate which type of crop. With this business activity, the community will benefit from moderate prices and transportation costs will be reduced since others will also join this business and foodstuff will be available when needed.

With the profit from this loan, Beatrice will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, help the needy, and also increase her capital. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and the fact that members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Additionally, the social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, flour, fertilizer, and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah, a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school, resides in a rented house and has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Ritah sells second-hand clothes at the market, and generates additional income by selling used shoes. In business for one year, she works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

Ritah has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes,  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Dúo Nuevo San Miguel Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVO SAN MIGUEL
El grupo esta conformado por la señorita Irma, quien se dedica a la venta de maíz  y elaboración de tortillas, venta de productos por catalogo (perfumería, cosméticos etc.), y  venta de comida  desde hace 20 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio, ella tiene  31 años de edad  es soltera, inició su negocio  con la ayuda de su mamá, con el tiempo inició su venta de tortillas, y en la tarde se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo en las cercanías de su aldea  y en su domicilio, la venta de comida lo atiende los días sábados y domingos, de esa forma ella ha trabajado duro para mejorar su condición de vida  y ser  un apoyo para su mama.  Ella sueña con tener un  local más amplio para sus diferentes ventas,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Nuevo San Miguel

This group includes Miss Irma, who sells corn, makes tortillas, sells products by catalogs (perfumes, cosmetics, and more), and has sold food for 20 years. Her business is located in the home. She is 31 years old, single, and started her business with the help of her mother. She eventually began the sale of tortillas. In the afternoon, she dedicates her time to the sale of products by catalog near her village and at home. She sells food on Saturdays and Sundays. She has always worked hard to improve her living conditions and be a support to her mama. She dreams of having a larger location for their different businesses. She is requesting this loan to buy corn and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to purchase corn and to purchase cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 51 years old. He is married and has 2 daughters. His wife is a housekeeper. Tahir has a small shop and sells products such as bread, butter, milk, sweets, salt, sugar, cookies, etc. His monthly income is 160 AZN. Tahir has 30 years of experience in this business. 

In his area, the demand for the products he sells is very high. People buy these products every day and use them in different cases. They buy products for their regular breakfast, supper and dinner and for unusual events such as family parties, holidays and so on. Small markets are very popular because products in such markets are cheaper than in big supermarkets.

Tahir borrowed 2000 AZN to expand his market business. This will help him improve his family's life and provide for his daughters education and future life. Tahir is a very responsible person and this is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy more products for his market.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh, 41, is married with two sons. His wife is a housekeeper. Taleh works as a seller in a small products shop. He sells sugar, sweets, cookies, a few sorts of tea and other items. His elder son helps him in his small business. Taleh's monthly profit is 195 AZN. 

Azerbaijan people like drinking tea with sweets and cookies very much. It's a tradition from ancient times to produce tea in Azerbaijan and sell it. Azerbaijan tea is very delicious and flavorful. Every day and every event with an Azeri family is followed by tea party. 

Taleh borrowed 1500 AZN loan from Credit Union for the first time. He needs this money to expand his business and help his family. Taleh wants to provide his sons an excellent education and cover his family's demands.

loans.use: to buy more products to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Merlin Noel

texts.fr: Noel est une jeune homme de 34 ans commerçant,fiancé mais père de 02 enfants âgés respectivement de 01 et 03 ans. ce dernier va déjà à l'école.  il a ouvert un prêt à porter qu'il gère dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans déjà. Son accueil chaleureux, sa créativité,ses bons conseils vestimentaires et son expérience lui ont valu une clientèle assez importante. Il voudrait également avec ce crédit s'acheter des ballots de vêtement pour augmenter son stock de marchandise. ceci lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Il souhaiterai réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Noel is a 34-year-old shopkeeper. He is engaged to be married, and a father to two children aged 1 and 3. The eldest goes to school. 

Noel owns a ready-to-wear boutique in the city, which he has been running for seven years. His warm welcome, his creativity, his reliable advice about clothing, and his experience have helped him to build a substantial customer base. 

Noel wants to use this loan to purchase bundles of clothing to bolster his stock. This will allow him to meet customer demand and to increase his profits. 

He will use these profits to expand his business and to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Imani Fmrs is a group of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Elizabeth selected as the Kiva representative. Elizabeth has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and she is on the right of the photo, with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).						

Elizabeth is 40 years old and has been a farmer for 30 years. She works as a farmer to provide for her four children. The community and other farmers know Elizabeth as friendly, reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, such as with the prayer group.  Elizabeth described her harvest last year as being excellent, but she hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and she is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. She joined One Acre Fund, so that she could get the best seed prices and get new farming methods. Because she likes being a leader and an active community member, she wants to help more farmers. Elizabeth has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and as a Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Elizabeth's life because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, and she was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Elizabeth hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow. Elizabeth also joined One Acre Fund because she wants better harvests.					

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Elizabeth and the Imani Fmrs Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Peninah's Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of seven farmers in Chwele District, with Peninah volunteering to be the Kiva group representative. Peninah is on the right in the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 81 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Peninah, a reliable member of the community, is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. She has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Peninah is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and burial committee.  She described her harvest last year as good and hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.	
						
Peninah first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and send her children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Peninah plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Peninah’s own life was improved because she has more profits from her harvest and is able to feed her family.  
							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Peninah and the Bidii Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  

With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is 42 years old, married, and has three children. The whole family works and they are all cooperating to pay their heavy life expenses. Majida started her business in 2009 when she opened a shop selling juices and cakes. She works hard each day to be able to earn money. 

Majida is requesting to a loan from Vitas s.a.l , which she will use to purchase merchandise to increase her sales by a large percentage. The loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to sell other goods in her store.

loans.use: to purchase juices and cakes

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Alpha is a group of nine farmers in Chwele District with Moses selected as the Kiva representative.  Moses has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 99 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Moses is 48 years old, married, and has seven children. He has been a farmer for 30 years. The community and other farmers know Moses as friendly.  Moses described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.	

Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Moses joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Moses plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Moses’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest.  

Moses and the Alpha Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One C62 Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Andrés Mauricio

texts.es: Andrés es un hombre de 33 años de edad, que desde hace 7 años se dedica a vender mercancía y ropa americana, especialmente para dama, inicialmente le distribuía a diferentes almacenes del centro de la ciudad, pero luego decidió montar el negocio en un local comercial abierto al público en sociedad con su novia, quien también tiene experiencia en esta labor; la mercancía la traen de Estados Unidos donde viajan 2 o 3 veces al año para comprar allí las prendas que ofrecen en su negocio; por esta razón solicitan el apoyo del crédito que será invertido en su totalidad para comprar pantalones, blusas, chaquetas, blusas, entre otros, con el fin de abastecer su inventario para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, aumentando sus ventas y el nivel de ingresos que recibe por su labor. De esta forma, Andrés desea seguir trabajando con empeño y dedicación, pues su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio, fortalecerlo y acreditarlo con mayor variedad de mercancía para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, generando una mejor rentabilidad que le garantice una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Andrés is 33 years old and has been selling American goods and clothing, especially for women, for 7 years. He initially distributed to different stores downtown but then decided to start his own business in a shop he opened to the public in partnership with his girlfriend who also has experience in this work. Their products are brought from the United States where they travel two or three times a year to buy the clothes they offer in their business. He asks for the support of a loan that will be fully invested in the purchase of pants, blouses, jackets, and others to fully supply his inventory and meet the demand increases of the Christmas season, therefore increasing sales and the level of income they receive for their work. Andrés wants to continue working with commitment and dedication as his greatest desire is to grow his business, strengthen it, and provide a greater variety of goods to satisfy the diverse needs and tastes of their clients which generates better returns that guarantee him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, jackets, and other clothing.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: El señor Ezequiel tiene 39 años de edad, su familia está compuesta de cinco miembros y sus tres hijos aun dependen de él. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria desde hace 21 años,  produce cebolla, papa y frejol para la alimentación de su familia y el excedente lo vende a comerciantes de la población. Proviene de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos y cultiva superficies muy pequeñas por lo que requiere un crédito para la compra de terreno agrícola, de esta forma logrará aumentar su producción y tener más ingresos para  mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Ezequiel is 39 years old. His family is composed of five members and three children still depend on him. He has worked in agriculture and livestock for 21 years. He produces onions, potatoes, and beans to feed his family. The surplus is sold to village traders. He comes from a humble family of low income and very small areas to cultivate. He requires a loan for the purchase of more agricultural land to increase production and have more income to improve the lives of his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loans.name: Vanessa Cristina

texts.en:
Vanessa is 34 years old, married and has two children, one aged 14 and the other 17 years.
She did not complete her studies and has always worked in trade, selling a bit of everything.
She had her first child at 17 and went to work very early with her husband's help to support her child.
Today she is a reseller of cosmetics, she is a consultant and has other people working with her. Like many other companies and brands in this segment she sells from her home, as well as door to door, and already has a strong and loyal customer base.

Her husband is also an entrepreneur and sells sweets, snacks, candies, and chocolates to small grocery stores.
Recently they achieved the dream of buying their own home and now want to expand the business. With this loan, she wants to increase her supply to have a range of products in stock and ensure prompt delivery. Her business has lost a lot of sales by not having enough variety.

loans.use: To buy cream, perfume/cologne, makeup

loans.name: Jorge Iván

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre trabajador y perseverante, ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos ganándose la vida a pulso. Durante muchos años trabajó como empleado en diferentes almacenes de venta de equipos celulares, allí aprendió el oficio y adquirió experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, lo que lo impulsó a tomar la decisión de independizarse para generar mejores ingresos que le permitieran salir adelante con su familia.
Actualmente tiene su propio negocio ubicado en un local arrendado, allí ofrece todo tipo de productos y accesorios para celulares y además vende los equipos de telefonía móvil según el encargo de sus clientes y artículos de papelería, cuenta con el apoyo de una hija, quien le colabora cuando él debe ausentarse.
Con el propósito de mejorar su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar surtido y mercancía al por mayor (carcasas, protectores de pantalla, equipos celulares y artículos de papelería), esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad de inventario y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Jorge manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y poder ofrecer más servicios, que le generen mayor rentabilidad para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking and perseverant man who has gotten his children ahead on a regular basis.  For many years he has worked at several cellular stores and learned this field and got experience in managing this type of business, so he decided to venture out on his own in order to earn more income with which to get the family ahead.

He has his own business located in a rented location, where he offers all types of cellular products and accessories.  He also sells mobile phones and paper goods based on customer orders.  He has help from his daughter whenever he is away.

He is asking for a loan so he can make improvements to his business and buy inventory and merchandise in quantity (skins, screen protectors, cellular equipment, and paper goods) which will allow him to offer a greater variety and satisfy his customer needs, thereby improving his sales and income.

Jorge says that his main desire is to expand his business and be able to offer more services that will generate more profit, so he can provide a better quality of life and a more prosperous future for his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat is a 45-year-old, married woman. For many years, she has been successfully running a small general store in her community, with the support of her husband. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

Since Azmat wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

Azmat is in her fifth loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Fullah Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, forty-four years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has four children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells cooked food. 

The members of the “Fullah” group have applied for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each, from SMT/ Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, each will be able to expand her business, both in terms of quality and size.
 
Featured leader Fatmata, for example, will use her share of the loan to buy cooking ingredients at wholesale, in order to stop buying these items at retail.  These items include ingredients like rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions, and fish. By buying ingredients at wholesale, she will cook more food at a lower cost, and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients at wholesale prices, including rice, palm oil, and tomatoes

loans.name: Assilasime Todome-Hompou Group

texts.fr: Groupement constitué de femmes, madame Sotossoudé est la responsable. Mariée, elle a 06 enfants et exerce comme activité la vente des produits de détails(balais, noix de coco, gari tomate...)à Aného. Elle a démarré en 1987 et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra entreprendre l'élevage des porcins et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Les autres sont en majorité dans la même activité et le gain tiré leur servira de mieux prendre soin de leur famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sotossoudé is the head of this women’s group. She is married with six children, and she works in Aného selling brooms, coconuts, gari, tomatoes, etc. She started this activity in 1987, and she is seeking a loan to bolster her stock. 

Her profits will help her to launch a new activity raising pigs, and to provide for her family’s well-being. 

Most of the other group members conduct the same activity, and they also plan to use their revenue to take care of their families.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, gari, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with three children and one goes to school. She has no additional family members. Annet resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

She operates a grocery shop at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for three years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy sweets, sugar, rice, soap, and biscuits for her grocery shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, sugar, rice, soap, and biscuits for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Grace has been working hard to manage her clothing shop. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Grace to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the stock in her shop. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell at her clothing shop.

loans.name: Remmy

texts.en:
Remmy is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kinobi in the region of Hoima in Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Remmy has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells beers, wine, spirits, and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Remmy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his bar and buy more beers, sodas, water, spirits, and furniture and will help Remmy to generate greater profits and educate his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to build his residential house. 

Remmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Remmy, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his bar and buy more beers, sodas, water, spirits, and furniture

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 24-year-old, Lebanese, married woman, living with her husband and only child. 

With great effort, Fatmeh started a business, which consists of selling clothes from her home. She has spent almost six years in this type of business and it is going well, thanks to her being always friendly to her customers and always offering them high-quality products, at low prices. 

Today, Fatmeh is eager to buy more clothes for her business, such as pants, coats, and jackets. She is certain that applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., will be a great help. Consequently, she will be able to improve her income and, therefore, her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business, such as pants, coats, and jackets.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. Four years ago, he got involved in the construction field. His job consists of completing landscape work. He works on a freelance basis, doing projects as well as working with individuals. 

As Ali is a hardworking young man; he serves customers wherever they are located. 

He reports that he struggles to get to customers, and that’s why he is asking today for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., as he wants to buy a minivan. He notes that the minivan will definitely ease his transportation, and even will allow him to reach a wider clientele and therefore earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a minivan

loans.name: Nardino Aminadab

texts.es: El cliente desde hace varios años se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con su siembra y así obtener una mejor vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: This gentleman has been raising corn and beans for several years and sells his products in different markets near his home.  He lives with his wife and son and uses his income to pay the household expenses.  He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, herbicides, plant disease controls, etc., as shown in the photograph, so that he can continue with his crops and create a better live with his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Vencedoras Con Éxito Group

texts.es: Dúo Vencedoras Con Éxito La encargada de este grupo es la señora Olga Marina, quien se dedica a la venta de refacciones y también almuerzos en su colonia desde hace un año.  Su venta ha prosperado cada día, ya que cocina muy rico y gana nuevos clientes todos los días.  Ella solicita su crédito para la  venta de tamales, ella aprovecha estos meses por  las fiestas de navidad y hace entregas de hasta quinientos(500) tamales a sus clientes cada semana.  Necesita comprar varias cajas de tomate, papa, chile pimiento, ajonjolí y varios condimentos para la elaboración de los tamales pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza para comprar las cajas de tomate que le hacen falta, por tal motivo necesita un crédito para encargarlas ya que los compra algo verde para esperar un tiempo exacto y tenerlo listo para la fecha.
texts.en:
Olga Marina is in charge of the Dúo Vencedoras Con Éxito group.  For the past year, she has worked selling snacks and lunches in her town.  Her sales have flourished because she cooks delicious food and gains new customers every day.

She is seeking a loan to sell tamales.  She takes advantage of these months because of the Christmas parties, and she fills orders of up to 500 tamales for her clients every week.  She needs to purchase many boxes of tomatoes, potatoes, chili peppers, sesame and other condiments to make tamales but at the moment she does not have enough money to purchase the boxes of tomatoes that she needs.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan so she can order them because she buys them when they are still green so she can wait until they are perfectly ripe, and have them ready when necessary.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make tamales.

loans.name: Eda Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Eda, tiene  48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos, 6 mayores de edad y dos de 11 y 13 años que estudian en colegio, con ellos también vive un nieto de 3 años que es como su hijo. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Eda  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, además también vende ciertas medicinas, artículos de bazar y gas de uso domestico lo cual le deja muy buenos ingresos ya que no son muchos lugares donde se vende este producto muy necesario en los hogares de la ciudad, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados, le gusta su negocio ya que  gana sus ingresos y está al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y gas de uso domestico. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito San José meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this gorgeous place where most of the people are very hard-working and work the seas.

In this place lives Eda, 48, who is married and has eight children with her husband. Six are over 18 and they also have an 11 year old and 13 year old who are studying in school. Living with them is also a three year old grandson who is like her own child. Her husband is a fisherman.

Eda has a grocery store in her house where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents among other things. She also sells certain medicines, miscellaneous items and household gas, which brings in good income as there are not many places that sell this product that is very necessary in the homes of the city. 

She works every day from 6:00am to 9:00pm and sometimes much later. Her children help her when they are not busy. She likes her business because it earns her income and takes care of the needs of her children.

She will use this loan to stock-up her store; she will buy groceries and household gas. She has already completed four loan cycles with Grupo De Crédito and she likes the loans because they are very helpful. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy groceries and household gas.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a 23 year old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport, alongside running a retail shop, which has helped him boost his income. He is facing challenges of weather changes and accidents; however, he has a vision of building a good house. Barnabas has asked for a loan to help him repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en: Tamazi is from the village of Gelati in the Tkibuli region. He lives with his wife and mother-in-law. His mother-in-law is a housekeeper and his wife works at the village's local school as a teacher, but her salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. With the help of his family members, Tamazi is extensively engaged in agribusiness. For more than 10 years, Tamazi has been involved in cattle breeding and in cultivating a plot of agricultural land. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Tamazi wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of 1,000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase cattle and sell more milk-products locally. Tamazi and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Phun's Group

texts.en: Phun, 34, is a mother of three daughters and a villager from Moung Russey district in Battambang province. To support her entire family, she does rice cropping on four and half hectare of farmland with the support of her husband. This is the business that she has been involved in for ten years. Phun, a seven-time borrower, joins a group of two with a five-time borrower to take out a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that she has repaid back completely has helped her to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy feed and piglets for raising. She highly believes that she can fatten her pigs in a healthy condition so that she can sell them for a good price and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets for raising

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David’s group has four group leader farmers and is located in Busia District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 40 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, David is pictured on the right of the Mkilima Group with his hand raised.
							
David is 47 years oda reliable member of the community.  He is married with 8 children.  David is 47 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 7 years to support his family.  In addition to this, David is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, prayer group and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund.  He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!
							
The 2013 Long Rains season will be David’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get new farming methods, get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  As an active member in his community, David also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  David plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his shildren to school, repair the home, save for the future, and buy a cow.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to feed the family.							
						
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  David and the Mkilima Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis operates a mobile money business on the city's outskirts. The business currently has a small profit margin because his capital is still small. Denis thinks that if he gets the loan, his capital base will increase and so will his profits. He hopes to venture into money lending, if his capital increases. He is hard-working. 

Denis thanks Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, for giving him a loan, even without security.

loans.use: to access working capital for mobile money.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop/kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. Beside the shop/kiosk, she also sells women's wrap clothes.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rohel Francisco

texts.es: Rohel, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea de la comunidad de Gracias Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, anteriormente compraba y vendía vacas y cerdos. Pero hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo de café.  La producción es vendida en grano en el mercado local de la zona. Esta solicitando 10,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de café. Con esta inversión el espera aumentar el cultivo y mejorar la producción de café. Su meta es obtener ganancias para mejorar su casa y la calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rohel is 29 years old, married, has two children, and lives in a village in the Gracias Lempira community.  He has always worked in agriculture, he used to work selling cows and pigs.  Ten years ago, he started working growing coffee.  He sells is coffee beans in the local market.  

He is seeking a loan of 10,000 Lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers, compost, and labor for planting coffee.  With this investment, he hopes to increase his crops and improve his coffee production.  His goal is to earn enough to improve his house and his children's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay for labor to plant coffee.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is a 21-year-old housewife who lives in Maynaguri with her husband Rajeshwar and their only child. She has completed her higher secondary  education (grade 12) and her husband has read up to class VIII (grade 8). Rajeshwar, engaged in part-time house painting work, is the only income earner in her family.  The income is not sufficient to cover their family expenditures as her husband's income is seasonal. When there is no work, he has to sit idle.
 
Dipa wants to help her family financially and decided to start a new business of farming potatoes because potatoes have a great demand amongst the other vegetables in her area. Potatoes are a very common vegetable in rural dishes, so Dipa is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation to increase her family income by selling them in the local market. She knows that too much fog may destroy the potato seeds, still, according to her idea, it is the best way to earn more profit without any business hazards. She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for their financial assistance in her bad days.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes in her own land.

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Bishakha is 19 years old and is married to Krishno in the village Narendrapur of Maynaguri. She has completed higher secondary level and has now involved herself in her own animal husbandry. Her husband passed class VIII (grade 8) and assists his wife in rearing the livestock. Their only child is still very small. Bishakha has been involved in this job for several years and sells different animals in the market. On the other hand, she possesses a vast area of green land for grazing her animals.

Now she wants to buy a dairy cow to generate surplus income for her family. She will supply milk and necessary dairy products in her locality. She requested funding  from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a cow. She hopes that she will reach her goal with the profit from her business and she gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to sell milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is a 41-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Kamal and two children in the small village of Maynaguri. Both Bindu and her husband are illiterate but can sign their names. Her husband is engaged in a small business. His income is too low to cover the family expenses. 

Bindu wishes to start her own business to maintain good livelihood and to give financial support to her family. They have a plot of land just two miles away from their house; the land and the weather of Maynaguri both are very favorable for tea cultivation. Bindu decided to cultivate tea in that land as she has a sound knowledge of farming and there is a great demand for tea in her area. 

Bindu is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner)  to purchase tea seedlings and fertilizers for tea cultivation, so that she can invest her own profit in her husband’s business which will increase their income. She is able to accept all the hazards that may come to her path in starting up a new business and tries to solve them with an exceptional inner strength. Bindu gladly thanks Kiva and BJS because she has reached beyond her expectations with their monetary support.

loans.use: To buy tea seedlings and fertilizers to cultivate tea in her own land.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old married woman who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

She earns enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. With this loan, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

Parveen wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 54-year-old married woman who has running a business selling milk with her husband. She has one buffalo which she uses to generate milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Razia has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase an additional buffalo. Razia is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional buffalo.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, age 55, is a married woman. She has been involved in manufacturing furniture for many years. Over time she has become known for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of four children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. In order to purchase good quality wood and packs of polish and nails in larger quantity, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history. Naseem dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood and packs of polish and nails.

loans.name: Shabraiza

texts.en: Shabraiza is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small vegetable shop in her community for the last 8 years with her husband. She is well-known for selling fresh and good quality vegetables and she earns a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy sacks of potatoes, onions, and ginger. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history. Shabraiza wishes to utilize part of revenues on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, onions, and ginger.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is a 52-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nazeeran has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. Nazeeran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for a vehicle.

loans.name: Shamma

texts.en: Shamma is a 41-year-old married woman. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shamma has applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. Shamma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband provides white wash services, which is the only source of income for the family. He belongs to a poor family and fulfills his needs only with great difficulty.

Her husband wants to purchase a variety of brushes and paint cans to continue his work. Therefore Naseem, as a member of three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of brushes and paint cans

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 38 años de edad, está casada y vive en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Betty es la venta de comidas está es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su labor comienza con la compra de pollos de buen peso que asegurarán un buen pago por sus ventas . Complementa sus comidas con la venta de frescas bebidas. Actualmente trabaja con el apoyo de una persona más quien se encarga del asado de las presas. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 8 años y desde entonces le va muy bien. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, así como también le permite estar en casa para cuidar y atender a sus hijos a los que quiere mucho y desea sacar adelante, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y establecer un restaurant de venta de comidas regionales en su casa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2800, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado comprará pollos, condimentos, aceite, limones, carbón, gaseosas y algunos utensilios que necesita para continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Betty, 38 years old, is married and lives with her husband and children, 14 and 7 years old, living comfortably in her own house. Betty's business is the sale of food. This is her principal source of income. Her work begins with the purchase of chicken of good weight, which ensures a good price for her sales. She supplements her food sales with the sale of fresh drinks. Currently she works with the help of one more person who is in charge of roasting the chicken.

She has had this business for nearly eight years and so far it has be going very well. She likes her business since it allows her to make sufficient income to support her husband with the household expenses. It also allows her to spend time at home and care for and attend to her children, whom she loves very much, and hopes to get them ahead. She has plans to expand her business and establish a restaurant selling regional foods in her house.

She is request a loan of 2,800 soles, therefore is hoping for your contribution in order to continue with her goals. In addition, she says that she feels great with her communal bank since she considers it a united group. WIth the loan she will buy chickens, condiments, oil, limes, charcoal, soda, and utensils that she needs to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, condiments, oil, and limes.
